author: Sinister Serenade
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2017
review_content: I will start this review by saying I have 4 great loves in my life: my husband, my son, my pets, and now my Contigo Autoseal Travel Mug. I bought a 16 ounce mug in Radiant Orchid, and I don't have one single complaint. Like was mentioned in one review I read, if you follow the clearly written instructions that are included with your mug you should have no problems whatsoever. "Funny taste"? WASH YOUR MUG LIKE IT SAYS TO DO! Leaking? FILL YOUR MUG AND CLOSE THE LID LIKE IT SAYS TO DO! "My beverage is hot!" Well, dummy, YOU put the beverage in there and the mug is designed to keep it hot so what do you flippin' think it gonna happen?I love that it is autoseal because I am often walking into work with an armload of stuff and now I don't have to be concerned with keeping my mug upright while I fumble with other things. There is also no longer a rush to chug my coffee before it gets cold! I'm currently sipping on hot coffee that was poured at 7am this morning. It is now 9:52am.Mug praises aside I come to you with a sincere warning to pay close attention to the source of the mug you choose.MY mug was distributed by Amazon so I had no problems whatsoever. However, I also purchased a mug for my husband at the same time through a third party that is long overdue to arrive, and I can't get a reply to my e-mails.
title: Love the mug, but make sure it ships through Amazon!

author: Diana G.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2016
review_content: I've had this thermos for about a month now and I am very pleased with it. I put my hot beverage of choice inside the thermos by 5:40am (what am I doing up so early?) And at around noon it is still nice and warm (not piping hot, but definitely not cold or even tepid) so that's give or take 6hrs. I have repeated this exact ritual nearly every day and it will always be deliciously warm at noon time. By the by, when I pour my beverage into the thermos it is piping hot, meaning if i were to drink it, my tongue would sting, but not really get "burned".  My tips/warnings:  - If you get one of the colored ones the paint WILL come off if you wash it in the DISHWASHER. I know some people were complaining about that, but in the safety manual it clearly states that only the unpainted stainless steel bottles are dishwasher safe.  - Wash it the way it shows you on the safety manual for optimal cleanliness.  - Rinse it right before every use. One time, there was some soap residue left over in my  lid and I ended up with gross soapy tea, so unless you're into that just run the lid under warm water.  - DON'T tilt the lid and THEN press the button to open the sippy cup or you'll get a face full of hot liquid. In other words, press the button while the thermos is vertical then tilt it to take a sip. This may seem stupid, but I had no warning (maybe I'm just an idiot) and now no one else has to look like a complete goof if it happens in a public setting.That's it for now, if anything else comes up I'll be sure to inform you guys.
title: Tips and overall Review.
verified: Style: No HandlePattern Name: 1 20 OunceColor: Stainless SteelVerified Purchase

I reported it to Contigo not once but twice, with photos attached, because there is a LIFETIME GUARANTEE.  Contigo never bothered to respond to either message.  My advice:  don't purchase their products.  The lifetime guarantee means nothing.
title: Contigo lifetime guarantee is a joke!

author: MommaB
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2017
review_content: UPDATE: Though I love the construction and performance, I do want to address the elephant in the room that SO many people have asked about ‚Äî the smell!! We‚Äôve had it a few months and despite regular cleaning, it DOES stink, no matter what I do. Vinegar, dish soap, baking soda, cleaning with a tiny wire brush, nothing has fully rid us of the ‚Äúold creamer, burnt coffee‚Äù stench. I‚Äôm really bummed...but this may be a 4x per year purchase in order to keep it safe to drink from.[Independent, verified, no compensation received for this review.]Coffee addict‚Äôs MUST HAVE! I‚Äôve been through 6 different mugs in six months. They‚Äôve either leaked, broken the flip-tab, were hot to the touch, didn‚Äôt clean easily, or just didn‚Äôt keep coffee hot longer than 30 minutes. This mug does all of those things and I couldn‚Äôt be happier, because I was ready to give up. That list above also includes another Contigo 16 oz. mug...kept things hot but the slider broke after 2 months and it was impossible to clean. But I digress...There was nothing negative to report about the features or performance during the month-long, multiple daily use ‚Äútesting‚Äù phase, so here are the results with which I was most pleased.‚Ä¢ Incredibly easy to clean top. Yes! No more waking up after hand washing the night before, ready to pop the top on, only to realize there‚Äôs a colony of mold setting up shop right where my mouth will be. The stopper piece that detaches for cleaning also comes of very easily and snaps back into place with no effort. You can put the lid on top rack of dishwasher but I‚Äôve heard that before and am not willing to risk it.‚Ä¢ Truly one-handed operation. No having to balance the steering wheel on your knees while you lift with your right, pop lid with left, and try to sip-flip-replace while trying not to spill and focus on the road.‚Ä¢ No-spill claims are actually TRUE this time!‚Ä¢ Stylish, modern appearance.‚Ä¢ Heavy-duty without looking or feeling like it.‚Ä¢ Description claims the 20 oz size keeps hot for 7 hours, but I have the 16 and after six hours the contents were about half as hot as when made (78 degree room). Pretty impressive.In short, buy this mug. Don‚Äôt spend $80 on a fancy thing when this sleek silver mug will do the job just as well if not better!Please let me know if this was helpful, thank you!
title: Updated...‚Äî-Coffee Snob Approved ‚Äî-

review_content: I purchased this expensive Contigo Autoseal mug based on reviews and comparisons with similar products. Initially it worked well, and I was impressed with the no spill function. author: Shawn M.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2015
review_content: This is the best coffee mug I have ever owned. bottom line: lives up to its promise. I actually forgot this mug in my office before a meeting and when I came back for it six hours later the coffee was still STEAMING. Bewildered by some of the negative comments... Why invest the time to log on to Amazon and complain but not take 67 seconds to read the enclosed instructions?? The rubber on the lid tastes funny? Wash the lid with soap and water before first use... AS INSTRUCTED. The cup overflows when you put the top on? Do not put liquid past the fill-line... AS INSTRUCTED. Yes, you just about fit an entire Dunkin XL (24 oz) inside if you go past the fill line, but this is sold as a TWENTY oz cup. So imagine that, overfilling it can cause it to overflow! Who knew? I burned myself because the coffee was too hot and/or I didn't know how to control the flow of liquid...? Surely that's a joke. Hot coffee is hot and this product is designed to keep it hot for a long time (which it does better than any other competing product I have tried in 2 decades). As for use... The, err, "drinking slit" (sorry, unfamiliar with technical coffee kid nomenclature) is exactly the same shape and location as that on every take-out coffee lid everywhere on earth. If you can't figure out how it works, go to the nearest Dunkin donuts or Starbucks or freaking McCafe and watch someone else drink a coffee. It is a fairly intuitive process.
title: Buy this at once and ignore the nay-sayers!

author: Tom Daniel
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2015
review_content: This was my 2nd generation purchase of a pair of Contigo Mugs from Amazon.  The first purchase was based on my satisfaction with a Contigo mug that I won as a door prize at a charity event, and in Jan 2014 I bought the two mugs to replace that one (when I left it in a classroom where I made a presentation - the teacher laughed when I asked if the kids, who know quality when they see it, had by chance returned it to her) - one for my wife and one for me. We used them regularly, and they traveled widely with us, for more than 18 months, but we eventually lost both - at different times.So, in June, I went back to Amazon to replace them.  I'm not sure why, but I couldn't find the same pair I'd bought earlier (they seem to be on the site now), so I ended up ordering this pair.  They were ~$38, compared to the ~$30 I remembered from the earlier purchase, but I figured that was just inflation.(?) Anyway, these came a couple of months ago, and I was surprised that they were quite different from the earlier ones.  The top has a different mechanism, which pops apart for cleaning (not sure, but it seems like an unnecessary improvement, since the previous design worked fine for us) and the overall construction is much lighter weight (thinner walled?).  I was surprised to find that I could fill this apparently thin-walled container with hot coffee and never feel any warmth coming through to the outside!  It obviously has a very thin, but very efficient, vacuum chamber between the inside and outside - impressive engineering!Until yesterday, when the mug I was carrying in a tote with a bunch of papers LEAKED all over the papers. I checked to make sure that the cover was screwed on tight (it was) and that the button hadn't somehow gotten pressed, but found that the mug still leaked a steady drip when inverted. I was dismayed to find that the other one also leaked when sealed as tightly as possible and held upside down.  Though I'd been impressed with the lack of drips from the earlier model, I'm very discouraged with the failure of this new design. It appears that the seal in the new cover design is based on a flimsy flexible plastic gasket that doesn't actually seal very well.  (See attached photo)I was surprised while shopping at our local Costco this evening, to see a pair of Contigo mugs very similar to the earlier design discussed above - for only $19.99!  I bought them and decided to return the other ones to Amazon - especially because of the price difference. The new ones have a different cover seal design, sort of between the original simple design and the flimsy gasket of the new one from Amazon.  I haven't tested them yet, but they look less likely to fail than the more complex ones that did fail.I was disheartened to find that Amazon won't accept return of items like this more than 30 days after delivery, so I'm stuck with them.  I apologize for the length of this review, but it's the best way I can see to protest Amazon's product selection, pricing and return policies.
title: Great vacuum insulation, Inadequate cover seal!
verified: Verified Purchase

author: David Tanner
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2019
review_content: After searching for months for a travel cup or travel mug to replace my 5 year old Starbucks Double-Wall Stainless, my research led me to chose the Contigo Handled AUTOSEAL Travel Mug Vacuum-Insulated Stainless Steel Easy-Clean Lid, 16 oz, Black/ . The company website was impressive with the variety of colors, styles and customer reviews, and once I read the claim that this mug kept  drinks hot for hours, I was sold.My mug arrived from Amazon, earlier than promised and the packing from Contigo worked perfectly to prevent dents and scrapes to damaged their visibly beautiful mug. As I removed the cover/handle, I was taken back  by the fact that this mug was of single wall construction and made me skeptic of the Contigo claim that their mugs kept liquids hot for hours.The  next morning, I poured my piping hot java in the AUTOSEAL Travel mug and headed on my 1 hr commute. I liked the mug's locking handle feature, but wasn't a fan of the ergonomic design, as I took my first sip after 15 minutes on the road.Just as with my Starbucks mug, I carefully took that first sip, anticipating that I'd burn my mouth but surprising the coffee wasn't piping hot but luke-warm. As I continued my commute, drinking warm coffee out of such a good-looking mug, I realized that the company's claim was a only marketing hype. "Drinks stay hot for hours on end."As a last ditch effort to make the AUTOSEAL mug work, the next day I preheated it with hot water. This gave me hotter drink for the first few minutes but it could not resolve the issue of the mug being on single-wall construction. I called the company to complain and they were ready to send out a replacement that same day, as they thought the mug was defective. I thanked them for their customer service efforts but declined after knowing that the mug was not defective, it's a result of the product's overall design.If you're looking for a travel mug that keeps your drinks,  hot or cold for hours, and disappointingly, the Contigo mugs definitely aren't the ones.  I'll continue my search for the ultimate and best travel mugs for me and my wife. In the meantime, I'll go back to using the Starbucks Stainless Steel Travel Mug. My advice to Contigo, is to make your mugs of double-wall construction, tweak the  clumsy handle and you'll have a product that's visibly beautiful and keeps the drinks inside, hot or cold for hours.
title: Visibly Beautiful, While Performing  Poorly at Keeping Drinks Hot
verified: Style: HandlePattern Name: 1 1 Count (Pack of 1)Color: BlackVerified Purchase

author: Hex
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2018
review_content: I ordered the Contigo Randolph mug because my Contigo Extreme pull top mug is getting a little old and I figured it would be nice to have another mug to alternate with. Every morning I make my coffee with a Keurig (using a refillable mesh filter to save the planet one cup at a time) in my pull top Contigo Extreme Mug¬†  Contigo Extreme Stainless Steel Travel Mug with Handle, 16oz, Silver          ... My Contigo Extreme 16oz mug took hitting the button for a large cup and then small cup on my Keurig to fill it leaving exactly enough room for creamer, so since the Randolph is supposedly the same size I did the usual... It turns out the mug is slightly smaller than the Contigo Extreme even though it says they're both 16oz, so it filled a little too much so the lid wouldn't go on without pushing coffee over the edge... A little bit of a pain, as now I'll have to sip some coffee to fit the lid on before I run out the door or pour some coffee down the drain. I'm not quite impressed with the push button for drinking, it would probably be better if you could also use the little lock on it to keep it in the open position so you can vent it a little if you have coffee/tea that's too hot  If I were to order again I'd go for another Contigo Extreme instead of this one, I've been using the Extreme for eight years, and though I've had to replace the top a few times over the years I think it's a better mug.

author: bruyere
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2018
review_content: Works just as described: keeps my morning coffee hotter longer (I have to let it cool before closing and sipping, unlike takeout) but exterior remains cool to the touch, doesn't leak (I throw sideways into my purse and take it on the train), clicks open easily for cleaning, good capacity, comfortable to hold (no handedness issue for lefties: holler) and fits in a cup-holder. I love the color and sheen! It's been on my wishlist for a while: only wish I'd splurged sooner!I like my oxo good grips too, but this one is better. The oxo has just one seal with a spring-loaded plunger and silicone gasket in the lid that's either open or closed (with that inaccessible internal channel for cleaning). It clicks when you toggle (think resonant ballpoint pen clicking level noisy in a work meeting or Sunday morning sermon). Whereas the contigo has a secondary safety lock that clicks (a light plastic snap) when you toggle it, but even when that's unlocked, you have to actively depress the open/release-to-drink button to dispense the liquid from the mouthpiece (better no spill design) and that active release is silent. I've also had the plunger sheer off of an oxo lid that was knocked off the counter, ruining the whole unit, whereas there doesn't appear to be a similar design vulnerability with the contigo.Update 11/2018 (3 months): 1. The finishing paint is wearing off in a ring around the base especially. Not that big of a deal. 2. Dropped once from three feet and no longer a leak-proof seal between the unit and the lid. Before, I could close and shake to mix my cream and sugar. Now it dribbles coffee especially near the release button if inverted. Kind of a big deal! Not covered under the lifetime warranty as manufacture defect or normal wear/tear. Debating whether it's worth replacing if this vulnerable. PS: By the time their poky customer service got back to me, I'd bought myself and promptly fallen madly in love with a ridiculously superior Zojirushi and I'm never looking back!!!
title: excellent insulation, easy clean, good shape and size, shiny, leak proof... until dropped!

author: BK
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2017
review_content: tl;dr: it's great at first, but if you use it regularly (3-5 times a week), it will either break or stop insulating within ONE YEAR!My gf and I have purchased two of these for each of us in mid Dec 2016 based on rave reviews and have been using them on a regular basis (3-5 times a week) for either cold or hot coffee. When they work as advertised, they are amazing! They have never leaked and hold temperature for 5-7 hours depending on hot or cold and how quickly I drink my coffee that day. Also, the Autoseal lid is pretty awesome. However, both of them have failed even before one year has elapsed. We always hand washed them after use and they never fell, so it's puzzling how these failures happen.Anyway, one stopped insulating on Feb 6th 2017, bringing the coffee to room temperature in 2 hours or so. I immediately contacted Contigo, and as others have mentioned, I received an automatic message saying that I would be contacted within 2-3 weeks, which felt quite long dealing with room temperature coffee. I heard back on Feb 22nd and after a fairly quick correspondence, they shipped out a replacement on Feb 23rd (it took an additional week for it to arrive) and told me to just discard the faulty one. I kept the lid since it was fine, and replaced the mug.Fast forward to Sept 2017, the other mug exhibited the same symptoms and stopped insulating. I contacted Contigo on Sept 13th and again I received the same automatic message. Today is Oct 3rd and I still have not heard from Contigo. What's more, when I was handwashing this faulty mug today, the bottom piece of the mug spontaneously popped out. As some other reviewers have mentioned, it's impossible to put this piece back into its place and now sharp edges are exposed making this mug entirely useless.I give high marks on this mug for being leakproof and having a convenient lid design. However, I cannot recommend this product because it will fail to insulate within a year. Even though "Limited Lifetime Warranty" might sound trustworthy since it bears close to 15k Amazon reviews at the moment, don't think that you will receive responsive customer service when your mug inevitably breaks down.I will update this later.
title: Great until it breaks within a year
verified: Style: No HandlePattern Name: 1 20 OunceColor: Stainless SteelVerified Purchase

author: Michael
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2019
review_content: Needed a  new mug for taking to work so I started researching on Amazon and came across this one that looked good and I thought I would take a chance on it despite some negative reviews.  Those reviews seem to be from people who didn't or wouldn't take the time to read the instructions.  People complained about how they would have hot drinks splash or spray on them when the depress the button to drink.  Well, if you depress the button to relieve pressure when the cup is away from your face you don't have to deal with that problem.  Another complaint from people was how the paint was peeling and chipping after they put their mug in the dishwasher.  Well, again, if you read the directions, you will plainly see that the only mug that is safe for the dishwasher is the plain stainless steel mug.  None of the colored models are supposed to be put in the dishwasher.  For those who complained about not being able to put their mug in the dishwasher you should've purchased the stainless steel model like I did so it can go into the dishwasher.  Mug seems to keep hot drinks hot for quite a while, even when outside in cold weather.  I couldn't give it five stars for two reasons, one for the fact it is not made in the U.S.A. and the other being that I don't know how well it will hold up over the next year or two.  So far after several weeks I am very pleased with it.
title: Read the instructions!!

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2016
review_content: Most stainless steel mugs have the "slide-top" that either leaks or falls apart after a few uses.  I had one cup that did not have a moveable cover with a plastic liner. author: D. Jenkins
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2016
review_content: Sigh..... Here's the down-low.Nice? AbsolutelyDurable? You betUseable?  Not reallyConfused?  Me tooI wanted to love this, I really, really, did.The lid is TALL. Thus, you have to tilt the container further than your brain thinks to get liquid out.  Then, after you tilt... and tilt, and tilt..., and tilt.... Where the $!#@ is the coffee?Then, all of a sudden you realize in horror you have tilted it too far and here it comes. The very top of the lid instantly gets skin scalding hot.So since I'm too lazy to return things, I started using this as a carafe for my normal porcelin coffee mug.  Even then, in normal room temp, it keeps coffee hot for a few hours.... Maybe...I saw a previous reviewer state this wasn't designed for a human to drink from.  I wish I would have listened, lol.Suggestions to Manufacturer:1. Make lid shorter in height, I see no reason why the mechanism couldn't be smaller to accomidate this.2. Somehow insulate the lips from the top of the lid.3. Add a lip shelf like every other coffee container on planet earth has.4.  Send me the updated human friendly version when you make it!! author: Liz Z√©landais
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2017
review_content: I now own 5 of these. Yes, a little OCD, but they have earned my compulsive loyalty to accompany my caffeine addiction.PROS:1) IT DOES NOT LEAK. I can confidently throw this into my purse or gym bag upside down or sideways, and there will not be even a drop that comes out. (Sure, if you're determine to make if fail, you can. Screw the top on properly, okay? It's an amazing feat of engineering--not magic.)2) It's easy to drink from. Just press in the handy button on the cap, which is solid (to keep it leak-proof), but doesn't require a lot of pressure. I don't have arthritis, but I would guess that it would be accessible even for someone who does. And the way the button is positioned, it's natural to how you hold the mug. You don't have to unscrew any lids or unsnap a flip top.3) It keeps drinks hot. I use mine for hot coffee, so I can't comment on how well it does for cold drinks. I'm not sure that it lives up to the 7-hour claim, but it keeps it hot for probably 4 hours, and reasonably warm for a number hours after that.4) It holds 20 ounces. I love the¬†  Zojirushi SM-KHE48AG Stainless Steel Mug, 16-Ounce, Smoky Blue          ¬†and all things Zojirush--but it's only 16 ounces. If you're like me and--if you're without your own mug--order your coffee by "whatever size you have that's closest to 5 gallons", that extra 4 ounces is a bigger deal than just 4 ounces. I do see however that Zojirushi now has a 20 ounce¬†  Zojirushi SM-SA60-BA Stainless Steel Mug, 20-Ounce, Black          ¬†so I'll be checking that out--but note that it's 50% more expensive.5) Dishwasher safe. I do not have time for the prima donna mugs that require hand washing.CONS:Note that I do not consider any of these significant enough to deduct a star.1) While the Contigo stainless travel mug does a serviceable job of keeping hot beverages hot, it falls a little short of Contigo's claims.2) The innards of the lid are not fully accessible for cleaning. I have a few versions of this mug, and the lids on the newer ones are now designed to easily pull out so more of that inner part is exposed when in the dishwasher, and I have never had any problem with anything gunky or science-experiment-like showing up. But the above-referenced Zojirushi does have a better-engineered lid for exposing every part for cleaning. I periodically soak my Contigo lids in a combo of hot water, dish soap & citric acid, and that seems to get any small amounts of coffee gunk out.For the price and what it offers, the Contigo Autoseal stainless travel mug is the best on the market. Get one (or five)!
title: The BEST for hot coffee lovers! And here's why...

This morning I had my beverage in it and the mug was sealed- fine. It titled and the hot chocolate started spraying out of the lid with the force of a thousand hurricanes! It went all over my kitchen and in my mom's face, burning her.
title: Definitely not leak-proof

author: Mary R. Kolk
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2021
review_content: There is NOTHING to dislike about the Contigo water bottle!  I was so dubious about buying this but my young grandson (15yrs) told me he takes it to school - fills it in the morning with ice /water and there is still ice in it when he gets home.  He's RIGHT!  We used to take the plastic bottled water in the car.  In the summer, we had to pack a cooler to keep it cold.  Now with our Contigo Stainless Steel Travel Mug OMG! we put in a few ice cubes in the morning and even though it sits in a hot car, it's still ice cold all day long!  How do they do that?  No glass thermos to break like in the old days.  I love our Contigo Stainless Steel Travel Mug and I HIGHLY recommend it.  Saves from buying plastic water bottles, is more convenient than plastic, and is much more environmentally friendly!
title: Goodbye plastic water bottles! Hello fresh cold water even in hot car!
verified: Style: No HandlePattern Name: MugColor: Dark PlumVerified Purchase

author: mrsmel269
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2021
review_content: Our son loves coffee. I bought throw away cups to take to school but the coffee gets cold quick and he kept using ours which was fine unless we needed it. So, I decided to look one up for him. I settled on this Contigo based on reviews and the size and the fact that the lid locks. It arrived wrapped up nicely and looked great. It holds a lot of coffee which is nice and it keeps the coffee hot for hours. It has a slim design so it is easy to hold in your hand. The body says hand wash and the lid is dishwasher safe. Kinda stinks, but it is really easy to clean. The lid has a part to push on that opens up the bottom for it to get a good clean. There is a lock button at the top so that it cannot leak and I like that you have to push a button to take a drink. It helps makes spills happen less especially when being taken to and from school. We didn't have any issues with dents and he has been using it a week and it is working great. This lid does screw into the inside of the cup, so you can only fill to the bottom of the screw part or else it will make a mess when you put the lid on. Not a big deal for us because it is a lot of coffee in there already, but my dad got a cup like that after having one that screwed on the outside so you could fill to the brim if you wanted so I figured I should mention it to anyone that might bother. You cannot fill this to the brim. All in all, we are very happy with it. My son said everyone at school said it's so fancy. Lol.
title: Great travel coffee mug
verified: Style: No HandlePattern Name: 1 20 OunceColor: Stainless SteelVerified Purchase

author: Bill S.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2019
review_content: This is the most ergonomic hot liquid mug I've ever used. I no longer have to fumble to open and close a snap on/off thing, or screw cap on top. Everything this product says it will do. it does. With a couple exceptions.It CAN leak, and hear's how. I noticed that after every sip (in my case, coffee), if I release the front AutoSeal button too soon before removing the mug from my lips, there often remains a small pool of coffee sitting inside the mouthpiece which, if knocked over, will spill out (see photo). I could release the liquid by pressing the AutoSeal button again, but that's awkward. After a few tests, I've simply adjusted my grip so that the AutoSeal button remains pressed, i.e the mouthpiece remains open until I am finished sipping, thus eliminating any pool of liquid forming. Kind of like bleeding an old-fashioned radiator (if you're as old as me!).The max timeframe my 192 degree coffee remained reasonably hot was 3.5 hours, not up to 7 hours as described.Read the use and cleaning instructions; they are very helpful in avoiding having the pressurized liquid inside splashing the drinker by pressing the AutoSeal button too close to one's face.  Apparently, this mug does create a terrific seal.By the way, I received a unit that had a small dent on the bottom, possibly due to being packed too loosely in the box. Regardless, I had a new one within 48 hours.
title: Don't forget to "bleed" before drinking!
verified: Style: No HandlePattern Name: 1 20 OunceColor: BlackVerified Purchase

author: Dantevius
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2021
review_content: I'll start off with the positive notes:- The leak and spill proof auto seal feature is the real deal. I shook this thing aggressively while it was full of coffee & creamer and not a drop was to be found anywhere outside of the mug.- For me personally, the 20 oz. capacity is nice for lasting me through my entire workday (although it does not keep liquids hot all day).- The auto seal feature is great and works well as a great alternative to having to constantly open and manually seal a mug with a standard/basic lid.- Unlike the travel mug I was using previously, this one fits snugly in my car's cupholders so it stays fairly still while I'm driving.- The aesthetics -- let's face it...this thing has a nice look to it.Now for the bad:- The "drinks stay hot for up to 7 hours...." statement is HIGHLY embellished. I poured hot, fresh coffee (immediately after it was brewed) into this thing at 7:20am but it was practically ice coffee by the time 11:30am rolled around. The quick dissipation of heat occurred while I was strictly using the autoseal opening to take sips while working in an office setting. The lid wasn't removed until the mug was washed after I returned home in the evening. My best guess is that the mug only kept my coffee warm for maybe 3 hours before it became tepid.I imagine the 7-hour maximum heat retention period must only apply if a liquid is at a roaring boil when it is poured in.
title: Nice, But...
verified: Style: No HandlePattern Name: 1 20 OunceColor: Matte BlackVerified Purchase

author: Jacob

review_content: This particular handle is very comfortable to hold with a nice rubbery grip. You don't have to turn the mug around or find the hole to take a sip.The black finish is very nice. It does not seem to attract smudges or fingerprints. The handle is attached to the lid, which makes for easy cleaning.The mug fits nicely in my Ford F150 cup holders. Not too snug. Not too loose.For a $20-$25 mug, the quality of this mug is exceptional.It's for theses reasons-- functionality, look, feel, price and portability-- that I think this is the best tumbler with a handle you can buy!

author: Doug Lindsay
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2021
review_content: I bought my last 20 oz. stainless steel Contigo West Loop 5 years ago this month. I had been using the 16 oz with no issues for about a decade before I discovered the 20 oz. I use it almost every day and it beats every other travel mug I have tried in terms of keeping drinks hot or usability. It keeps beverages hot or warm for hours, doesn't drip, leak or spill, holds a lot and fits perfectly in my hand and car's cup holder. I drink very strong coffee and green or black tea on a regular basis. Would it be challenging to get the screw top lid as clean as it the day I got it because of all the little nooks and crannies and mechanics of the little spring lever? Of course. If that is your goal you should probably look somewhere else. I also have ceramic coffee cups that seem permanently stained from my strongly brewed beverages. It doesn‚Äôt bother me. I scrub it with a bottle brush and a toothbrush and soak it in near boiling hot liquids, i.e. coffee and tea, on a regular basis. It's been with me for thousands of miles of driving, hundreds of miles of walking, weeks of camping. It's survived many knock-overs and drops on the ground or floor. I just bought a new one on Amazon today at about twice the price of the last. It's worth it to me.
title: Sturdy travel mug keeps things hot on the inside, dry on the outside.
verified: Style: No HandlePattern Name: 1 20 OunceColor: Stainless SteelVerified Purchase

author: A.Texas.Yankee
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2018
review_content: *UPDATE* Original review below update.After a little less than 1 year, this cup has become unusable. The cup will absorb any and all chemicals and retain the scent and flavor of the chemical. It did it from the beginning, but it has progressively gotten worse. I have tried every method to wash the cup but the type of plastic used in this cup retains the chemicals. So the coffee never is a good cup. It retains the oils from the old coffee, or any additives you put into the coffee (bullet proof coffee as a prime example). And if you wash with soap of any kind, the cup is absolutely ruined... Bleach, the same, vinegar, the same, HOT water... no change. Granted the cup really isn't that much of an expense, but to be unable to use the cup at all after washing... that's not acceptable, especially since every other travel coffee mug I have ever purchased has never had this issue. I typically only use vinegar to clean my coffee items, and out of every apparatus I own, this is the only one that vinegar flavor is retained and you can continue to taste the vinegar in every cup. No matter how many times you wash it with just hot water. I have even let coffee soak in it over night to hope it will draw out all the other chemicals retained by the cup, but no luck. I am in search of a new travel mug, but a Contigo product it will not be.I'm a home roasting coffee drinker so I'm an above average coffee consumer in terms of being picky and use the Contigo EVERY day. That being said, the Contigo has exceeded my expectations by far. It truly does not leak. It rattles around in my cooler and I'm comfortable enough keeping in cooler with papers. My only negative is the plastics used inside do tend to get the oils from the coffee built up pretty good so it does need a good scrubbing. Since the plastics also do the same for cleaning products, don't use anything to clean other than a scrub brush and hot water.
title: Was a great product, but then... *UPDATE 12/28/2018*
verified: Style: No HandlePattern Name: 1 16 OunceColor: Latte Trans MatteVerified Purchase

author: Christian K
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2020
review_content: So I ordered these cups for the worst reason a person can ever order something. I ordered them because they had over 78,000 reviews. That makes me on of the morons of the world that's just following the masses. I've never written a review after using something one time but this product warrants just that.First impression, this cup is really light. I have a few light, insulated mugs but they're my cheap, rarely used mugs. They stay in the cupboard for side uses, like tea since nothing but coffee is allowed in my daily mug. But maybe Contigo figured something out and it's still a good mug, so move on. Next thing I noticed is that it's impossible to drink out of this mug without burning yourself. The pour opening is on the outside edge of the lid meaning you can't sip the coffee, you pour it directly into your mouth. If you like hot coffee, this does not work. All my previous, quality mugs had a lip around the lid. This lip allows you to tilt the mug up, releasing the coffee into that cap, then you sip it from the cap. In a quick, 10 minute search of Amazon coffee mugs with this feature in mind, I can't find another mug with this major flaw. Infact while typing this, I brought my new Contigo mug back to the kitchen and poured the coffee into my old mug so I could drink it.Second issue, My last two mugs were excellent in thermal properties. I used to take my coffee with me to Viking games. We'd leave the house around 9:00 in the morning and drive downtown. It's Minnesota so translated, that means COLD winters. We'd hop out of the truck and go grab breakfast at Keys or somewhere and then walk to the dome. My coffee would sit in a truck, at potentially sub zero temperatures, for upwards of 7 hours. When we'd return to the truck I was always amazed because, though my coffee wasn't piping hot, it was still drinkable. This mug on the other hand went with me to a project I'm doing in a downtown condo yesterday. Climate controlled, t-shirt environment. My coffee was cold and undrinkable by maybe 1:00. Might as well put it in a paper cup and saved the $30 for something useful.This is my only experience with Contigo so I won't right them off as a company but this mug is a complete failure.Sidenote: it looks pretty. To bad that's the least important feature of a travel mug.
title: Extremely dissapointed

My new wht 1 is 16ozs, but yet I filled w water n poured in2 the 20 oz, same size, so I must of got a mis labeled 20 in place of a 16. The reason I go in2 all this is 4 those Morn Coffee drinkers like me who has 2hav that JOLT on the long drive 2 work. We all want a GOOD LEAK PROVE MUG That stays Warm 4 awhile. author: C. G.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2020
review_content: I‚Äôve waited about a year to review this, as I wanted to see how well it performed and to date it is still the best coffee cup I‚Äôve ever owned. I‚Äôve never once had a spill with this cup. I take it to work everyday in my bag, the same bag I carry a computer and a iPad and papers etc within. That‚Äôs how confident I am. I am sure to always lock the button before I leave for work. I drive 40 mins both ways commute, but it‚Äôs usually empty on the drive home. I‚Äôve kept coffee in it for 3 hours before taking a drink and still manage to burn my lips, just a little bit but not scald, it‚Äôs the good kind of burn from coffee, the kind that wakes you up a bit and gives that kick but doesn‚Äôt hurt. Basically it keeps it at the perfect amount of hotness for coffee.Pros: lightweight, easy to carry and store in a bag. The lock prevents inadvertent leaks when in a bag. Holds warmth to an excellent degree. Interchangeable lids, you can use the same lid for different coffee cup sizes of the same brand. 16,20,22, 24 oz coffee cups of this brand all share the same style lid so I never have to guess. We have 3 of these cups, so we also have 3 lids. Dishwasher safe! Holy cow this is a big one! Top shelf only folks, keep that plastic safe from the dishwasher heater. Easy to hand wash mostly, except for very inner part of lid, not a big deal as the mechanism folds out of the way to wash the important parts.Cons: not many, I guess one con is it‚Äôs only top shelf rated for dishwasher..that‚Äôs kind of not a hard thing since I have 2 dishwasher shelves. The only real con, which is a super nit-noid dumb con is that because of this cups excellent sealing properties, when it is empty slight changes in pressure can cause the opening gasket to make weird noises. Like a kind of hissing noise because the air is trying to stabilize due to pressure changes in the atmosphere. It‚Äôs a dumb con but honestly it‚Äôs the only one I can think of.Definitely would buy and will buy again in the future. No more worries about coffee spills or stains getting in or out of the car or at work or when walking while holding the cup. 5 stars! Highly recommend!

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2017
review_content: I rarely ever write reviews, but felt compelled to do so in order to save anyone else from having this thing drip all over them. author: K williams
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2018
review_content: What I like best is that it doesn't leak, even when it's tipped over.  My mug is currently filled with hot water, and laying on it's side while I type this review.  No leaks (so long as you make sure the top is screwed on completely).  I am a little worried that the flow button could accidentally be pushed if I throw it in my bag, so I'm a little careful there.  I also like it's ease of cleaning.  I purchased the stainless steel model expressly so that I could stick it in the dishwasher once a week or so to give it a sterilization, but it's easy to clean by hand in the between times.The mug will keep my tea HOT for at least an hour, and warm for several more.  I can make tea in the morning, and it's still at least warm at noon (if I haven't finished it by then).Almost too big for small hands.  Why I gave it only 4 stars is entirely subjective and fit-based.  I am a small woman, with small hands, and the mug is almost too big for me to hold in one hand comfortably.  I really appreciate the silhouette profile - the inward dip right where I hold the mug makes it possible for me to hold it and activate the pour button with one hand.  I also have a little trouble with the top of the lid.  The top is pretty much flat, which means I stub my nose every time I go to take a drink.  This is likely only a problem for people with longer noses (like me).  I've included two photos of me holding the mug, so you can see what I mean about the size and grip.As a consummate review-reader, I know how important fact-based reviews are.  I try to make my reviews as useful as possible.  If you find this review helpful, please let me know by clicking the "Yes" button below.  Seeing that people have liked my reviews helps encourage me to keep writing (and taking weird review-oriented photos).  If you have a question, leave a comment and I'll let you know if I know the answer.

author: James Gockel
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2017
review_content: Alright, so I went based on reviews of this thing.It's got three stars! The technology is great, no leaks, keeps hot hot, and cold cold. GREAT!But that's where the greatness stops.Day 3, and rust is already showing on the rim of the steel. WTF? Ok, I'm not really concerned, I used it for water over the weekend. As long as it doesn't inhibit functionality, I'll be ok.Day 4, Coffee in the morning, and water in the afternoon. I work in the desert I need water, but I need coffee in the morning. The intent was to have  coffee for my morning drives, and clean it at work. I decided I want water in this too... The coffee smell just won't come out of the lid. I washed it for 15 to 20 minutes trying to get the smell out. Nope... water with a hint of coffee smell is what it's now going to be.It's a great tumbler. But these two things must take off 2 stars. Because now I need to buy one just for water, and keep one just for coffee.However, this holds 4 "cups" of coffee (labeled by my coffee maker's caraf, or "2 human servings of coffee"). And the "autoseal" is great absolutely no leaks. Air return is around or in the lock button. Press the button and the mouth seal opens, release the button and the seal closes.Don't close the seal while you're drinking or still have it up to your lips, as it creates a wierd pressure difference and you'll spit a bit on your upper lip.
title: I like it, but now I need another. =(

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2019
review_content: I bought Contigo mugs 4 years ago and both mugs are still going strong and not leaking a drop. I just make sure the button is on "lock" and drop it in my purse or backpack.  It also keeps the liquids hot and warm for hours...pretty amazing.  Got a set for my skeptical late 20s daughter the following year; she shrugged as if to say "sure, Mum" but then a month later she offers "hey, those mugs you gave me are really good!" So, there's your proof.  This last set of mugs I bought recently have a slightly different design in the mouthpiece, and I got them as a gift for my sister who was visiting.  We headed out on a week-long road trip and my brother in law kept commenting on how great the mugs were, keeping things hot and leak proof.  Therefore, it's been verified by three different sections of my family and we love Contigo mugs!  The only caution is not to wash the colored mugs in a dishwasher as the color film peels off (my somewhat red mug is proof) - wash by hand (silver mugs have no color foil so they are fine in dishwasher, as are the tops). Highly recommend!
title: Best mugs around

author: J. D. Edwards
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2021
review_content: I really wanted to like it.  I even put it away for a while so I could try again.  I give up.  Although it does seem to be well insulated for lasting heat, and I am a fan of either steel or glass linings for coffee, the design, though innovative, just is not effective.  As others have pointed out, cleaning is certainly not simple.  More frustrating, though, is the design for regular usage.  I simply could not, even with practice (and it's unbelievable I actually need to use the world "practice" with a coffee vessel) I could not consistently drink from this while driving (or standing still, no matter) without dribbling coffee down my face or dripping it onto my clothes.  It simply is not an intuitive, effective design, especially if the beverage is very hot and you only want a small amount at a time.  I actually threw mine away.
title: Bad Design
verified: Style: No HandlePattern Name: 1 20 OunceColor: Matte BlackVerified Purchase

author: Andy J
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2017
review_content: The primary function of a travel mug is to be able to drink from it, and this mug fails miserably here. You can't drink from it without making a mess. The opening at the top is awkward with no lip to catch the liquid during and after you take a sip, so you are left with constant dribble on your chin and lap. You basically have to put your whole mouth around the opening and seal with your lips, after which point you must learn the skill of slurping up the last few drops as you remove your lips. On top of that, you have to tilt the mug much higher than normal mugs to get the liquid to flow and basically dump it into your mouth. Not ideal for scalding hot coffee, nor for drinking in a car with a low ceiling (kept hitting the ceiling with the mug before I could get any liquid to flow). Never had so much difficulty drinking from a travel mug. No clue how this thing has so many positive reviews. I didn't even evaluate the other features of the mug (heat retention, sealing ability, etc) because this thing is quite simply a non-starter.
title: Fails miserably at its primary function

author: Utopiac
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2021
review_content: My fault, but I wasn't paying attention to the size and thought I was getting a replacement for my old Contigo 20 oz travel mug.  I love Contigo mugs - they keep stuff hot for a long, long time, and they don't leak.  They hold up when you drop them, and they come in really amazing colors.  This time though, I decided to go with the plain stainless steel. Was I ever surprised when I opened it and found it was t 24 oz mug!  It was like a mini thermos or something!  It's enormous - not like one of those Bubba mugs that makes you look like you walked out off the Beverly Hillbillies or something - but it's BIG.  I almost sent it back, but thought why not?  It took a little getting used to, but it fits in my cup holders and I have a lot more coffee or tea than in the 16 or 20 oz mugs.  (obviously).  Don't get this one if you have to wait to go to the potty, or if you have to go frequently.  This is a large one, and I really like it!  Contigo does what it says it will do - keeps hot stuff hot and cold stuff cold and it doesn't leak.  Period.

author: JustMe
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 17, 2021
review_content: I got the 24 oz stainless steel with no handle.  Really like it so far.  I know from having similar lids before that the best thing to do is clean it out pretty quick after finishing the drink.  If it sits and gunks up, it's going to be difficult.  Their instructions say to soak for 10 minutes or something like that, I just rinse with hot water soon after finishing drink, get some soap in there too, and let it dry.  If that doesn't sanitize it well enough and I get sick and die, at least I enjoyed my huge cups of hot coffee on my way out.  I've still only had a couple weeks but it seems like it doesn't leak. date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2018
review_content: A great concept.  Even the video by the manufacturer was promising. author: Lacey
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2021
review_content: So many "leakproof" mugs are not...but this one locks so you can't accidentally push it in your bag. I love my leakproof Contigo water bottle, and this is my favorite coffee mug now too. The color was a little different than I expected (it isn't quite as dark as the photos), but I'll chalk it up to computer screen vs reality --color was a bonus not a main feature for me anyway. I can put this water bottle in my backpack and not worry about getting my notebooks wet and coffee stained, and it lets me get coffee and not drink it until I get to class but it's still hot. This is my go-to travel mug now. It IS hard to clean. My suggestion is to always at least rinse it out when you're done. I have a latte machine at home, so mine always has milk in it. I'm always out of the house all day, so when I'm done with my coffee I just rinse the mug out in a bathroom sink somewhere making sure to rinse water through the lid (the hardest part to clean). Then, at the end of the day I have some little dish brushes (mine are OXO and awesome) and use those to clean the cap with soapy water. This keeps the lid from getting gross. the little silicone lip spout can be popped off to clean between the plastic and the silicone piece to make sure there's not milk debris and bacteria trapped in between, but I usually only do this every couple of days because the rinsing helps keep anything from getting stuck. Highly recommend if you can handle getting into the habit of rinsing it when you're done, or you don't put perishable liquids in it.
title: Love the lock
verified: Style: No HandlePattern Name: MugColor: ChardVerified Purchase

author: leelee33
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2016
review_content: What I love about it:I bought this to bring with me while traveling for work. It keeps my coffee hot for about two hours and keeps it warm enough to drink for another two hours. I also bought the Contigo SnapSeal Vacuum-Insulated Stainless Steel Travel Mug, 16-Ounce, Gunmetal and found the hours hot to be about the same.The AutoSeal has been proven spill-proof to me. I have even tossed it to a friend on the way out the door and there is not so much as a drop of coffee lost.Complaints:The AutoSeal has a complicated lid system that is very tough to clean. While the parts inside the lid flip out, my brush still has a tough time reaching all those nooks and crannies. The SnapSeal has one component under the lid that rinses off without the trouble.The bottom of this mug is also very square and does not sit in my car cupholder- the kind that has a smaller ring toward the bottom and a larger ring on top. The SnapSeal version is more tapered and will sit in the cupholder securely.I am in hotels a lot and this mug will not fit under the very popular hotel-version Keurigs, but it DOES fit under normal Keurig machines.This mug will not get clean without the use of a bottle-brush. It seems to hang on to a film if you just try to wipe it out with a cloth or a sponge. It also can not be put back together or even have the lid just resting on the top when stored in a cupboard. I'm not sure why, but it never seems to be dry enough and if the lid is on it, it develops a horrible smell. Having to re-clean it adds time in the morning. Better to lose the space.
title: AutoSeal Vs. SnapSeal

author: Rustjaw
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2016
review_content: Works flawlessly, doesn't leak, and keeps my coffee hot for an extremely long amount of time. Like, a REALLY long time.The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars, is because the inside of the cap is an absolute nightmare to clean. There are a few moving parts, and a ton of nooks and crannies for bacteria and all sorts of general-use coffee scum to hide in. You can pull back some of the operating parts to get a better angle to wash the inside, but it doesn't help as much as it needs to, and once opened it's still really in your way.The threads have the same problem. They are semi-covered by the outside sheath and you have to really get in there with a Q-tip or a toothbrush to get it sparkling.Pictures are showing the underside of the screw cap un"opened" and opened. Hopefully you can see what I mean about the nooks and crannies, they get very disgusting very quickly if not thoroughly cleaned with hot water and soap. Likewise, the soap gets stuck in there too and will make your drinks taste like it unless you diligently wash it out as well.I still very much recommend this product, and will purchase another if this one stops functioning.
title: Like, a REALLY long time

author: TLC_936
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2020
review_content: Don‚Äôt bother with these 24oz. cups! I bought 2 of these, one for hot beverages and one for cold. They aren‚Äôt leak proof at all!I am constantly getting hot coffee sprayed all over me when I try to swirl the coffee in the cup. The other day I put the cup across my lap and someone called my name and pointed at the cup, which was leaking from the mouth hole, even though it was locked, and down my leg and wheelchair. My favorite hoodie is practically ruined because it has coffee spray all over it. Don‚Äôt tip the cup too far, i.e. more than level with your mouth, otherwise you will get a face full of coffee from the lock button, especially if your nose touches the button while you drink. Be careful with putting ice in your cold drinks in the 24oz cup, small pieces of ice get caught in the mouth piece, like in the picture, and the cup won‚Äôt fully seal and you will get sprayed. Sometimes you‚Äôll be able to get the ice out by blowing it out, other times you will have to wait until it pops it up your nose.On another note with leaking, with the cup I use for iced tea (which does stain the inside of the lid), I have noticed that if I leave it sitting, overnight for instance, it leaks where the button is and dries there to make a sticky mess on the outside of the cup and whatever it‚Äôs sitting on. It doesn‚Äôt matter how much liquid is actually in the cup, it could be full or only a few sips left, and it still leaks. That is what the other picture is showing. I have tried everything so prevent this but it still does it anyway. And with the larger version, make sure after you take a drink, that you close the mouthpiece, and then take another sip because your beverage will get caught on the rubber mouthpiece.It doesn‚Äôt keep your drinks hot or cold for very long. Hot, maybe an hour or 2 if you‚Äôre lucky, and by hot I don‚Äôt mean hot, I mean warm at best. Cold drinks it does a little better and you might have small pieces of ice at the 4 hour mark depending on how much you put in the cup to begin with. I‚Äôve noticed that it‚Äôs losing the heat/cold from the lid and on the cup where the lid meets the cup. Could be a design flaw for just this specific model because I haven‚Äôt noticed it in the smaller cups but I don‚Äôt use those as much.Also, when the cups first arrived, one was in perfect condition, the other had a scratch on the inside bottom where the sides of the cup meet the bottom. I don‚Äôt know if this is an Amazon issue (like maybe they sent me someone‚Äôs return) or if it‚Äôs a manufacturing defect, but getting one in perfect condition is a pain. I also bought another set that had the same kind of scratch and was rusted a little at that same seal. So it‚Äôs kind of better to go to the stores and buying these, otherwise be prepared to return.The buttons are surprisingly easy to push. But for someone with arthritis, the lock button may be a little hard sometimes. The lid isn‚Äôt hard to push down and twist as they suggest, but it is easier if the grooves on either the lid of cup are a little wet, but then you have to worry about your contents leaking.If you still decide to order this cup after all the issues I‚Äôve told you about I wish you luck.

author: E. Scher
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2021
review_content: I have really low expectations for everything, so when something works I find myself pleasantly surprised..It really does keep items hot or cold for a surprisingly long time, it's easy to drink from in SPITE of actually being leakproof, and it's easy to clean.For cleaning it, the bottom portion is easy and no instructions are needed.It's supposedly not dishwasher safe, but that's just for the external color treatment. It's stainless steel, of course you can put it in the dishwasher.I don't put the top in the dishwasher, even though the instructions say that you can. What I actually do is this:1. I wash it off with plain water and a soapy sponge.2. The I run hot-ish water through it while holding it upside down with the trigger open.3. Finally, I fill most of the body with the hottest ware that the sink gives me, put a little dish soap in it and put the top on.One the top is on, I just shake it up, pull the trigged to release the pressure the shaking caused, and set it on the counter, upside down. In the morning I just dump the water,  rinse everything off and put fresh coffee in it.So yeah...I'd say it's worth buying.

author: Lee the Builder
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2019
review_content: If I did it bears doing again. We have more than a dozen of these now and they are our regular drinking glasses as well as travel mugs. No spillage, eons of time to consume hot hot coffee or cold cold drinks before they go tepid. Ice remains ice for many, like 8 hours on a hot day.Problems, yes. This particular review is after buying a pair on sale and one is blue. I try to buy stainless only, as in without a painted / anodized skin. Inevitably that skin will go away. Dishwasher cycles, rolling around on the car floor, bouncing down the stairs in cup races between grandkkids. The colored surfaces show their age much more readily than the au natural.Pro tip. When going for a sip of hot coffee or hot whatever, holding the mug upright use the button that opens it for you to drink before it gets to your face. Because hot things pressurize an airtight space and need to burp away from you, not on you, that's why. It will become second nature and in the same way that telling someone not to hit their thumb with a hammer doesn't have nearly the lasting value that actually hitting your thumb with a hammer does, telling you not to open the mug in close proximity to your face will not be nearly as impactful as the event.Lastly, nothing lasts forever. These Contigo contraptions have metal on plastic, they have screw actions, they have internal moving parts that include seals and whatnot. So yeah, not going to last forever. Ours, treated entirely utilitarily, last years. More likely they get borrowed but never returned. There's another name for that but I promised to get along with my wife's family.

author: The 2000 Man
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2020
review_content: Now that I've had a chance to use this for a few weeks I thought I would write a review. The company claims it will keep a beverage hot for 5 hours. I've found that's just not true. However, it doesn't really matter. Who takes 5 hours to drink a mug of coffee? Anyway, after 4 hours my coffee is just lukewarm. It is absolutely leak proof. You can lay it on its side and it won't leak a drop. It does take a bit of effort to press the little button, but that's why this mug is leak proof. I do notice a bit of a metallic taste that I thought might go away after a few uses, but it hasn't. If you get one of the painted mugs the company recommends that you not put it in the dishwasher. I've put mine in the dishwasher a few times and so far it hasn't seemed to hurt the paint, but I expect that eventually it will start to peel or fade. That shouldn't affect the functionality of the mug. All in all I'm satisfied with this purchase.
title: Five Hours is a Bit of a Stretch

author: Kyle Richardson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2017
review_content: I've gone through different types of mugs, but this is about the best I found. Although it could be better.I've had this mug for about a year now. While I love it, it still has the mold issue that most travel mugs have.PROs- vacuum insulation keeps liquids hot for hours- durable construction keeps it issue free after several drops- one handed operation with auto-seal prevents spills- lock helps prevent spills when in a bag- no completely inaccessible places for liquid to get to and grow moldCON- While the lid isn't completely inaccessible, there are spots, especially around the hinge, that are hard to get to and clean, which leads to mold. Don't forget to remove the two seals to clean inside them every once in a while.It's still my everyday coffee mug and haven't seen anything better. There are redesigns that would help prevent mold and enable easier cleaning.POSSIBLE IMPROVEMENTS- make the underside of the lid smooth and concave like the upper side prevents corners and cavities- making the flap removable allows access to the open hinge area on the under side of the lid, which is incredibly difficult to access with any kind of brush- make the lock knob solid. I still haven't found anything to clean this area with.
title: The best around, but could be better.
verified: Style: HandlePattern Name: 1 1 Count (Pack of 1)Color: GunmetalVerified Purchase

author: Vexx22
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2020
review_content: Every so often, I go on another search for the perfect coffee tumbler, thinking maybe someone has come up, since my last purchase, with a better one. But this particular tumbler by Contigo remains the best in existence. I've had several over the years and they've made steady improvements to the lid mechanism so that it's easier to clean. It still has a multitude of nooks and crannies for creamy coffee to hide in, but it's easier than it once was - and there's no denying it's the best closing and easiest to drink from. So it's worth the little extra effort to keep it clean. It keeps the coffee piping hot for about an hour, and sufficiently hot for a couple more. It does even better if it's primed with hot water before adding coffee. It does not leak. Ever. You can hold it upside down, stuff it in a backpack, put it in a roomy pocket - it just won't leak as long as the gasket at the mouth opening remains intact. It's steel construction, so it's nearly indestructible. I cracked a lid once when it rolled off the roof of my car, but short of that, the lid, too, is pretty tough. I've noticed these gradually lose their insulating properties after a couple of years, so I factor that in.I also love that these come in a multitude of colors in gloss and matte. I will say that I probably won't get another in the "plum" shade - it's a very muted, almost grey shade and I find that I lose track of it as it tends to blend into the background; I'll stick with something more vibrant.
title: Still the unrivaled champion coffee tumbler
verified: Style: No HandlePattern Name: 1 One Size (Pack of 1)Color: Dark PlumVerified Purchase

author: Stringzs
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2018
review_content: I got this double pack a few months ago. The silver one is machine washable but the blue one is not. I would suggest getting the machine washable one only as its hard to completely get coffee smell out by hand washing. Of course, if you are using it for water or something else, it may work good. It is good with cold drinks but hot drinks cool down reasonable fast. But all in all, it's a decent buy.My problem is the horrible Contigo customer service. The lid on one of my mugs stopped working within2 months of purchase, so I emailed them hoping for a quick fix. Well, it's December now, and still nothing. For a LID. Here is how is almost comical and highly inept situation played out.----------------------------------------------Aug 27: Filled online form for warranty with pictures (which they ask for). Got email reply:Your warranty claim has been submitted.  Plan on hearing from us within 2 - 3 weeks, if not before.  We‚Äôll be in touch soon!Thanks,Contigo Consumer Care--------------------------------------------------OK. 2-3 weeks just to hear back. I waited for a month but nothing.Sept. 21: Sent email again. Dear, Contigo, I had reached out to you regarding a replacement of my lid about a month ago, but have not heard back yet.Please help.--------------------------------------------------------------Oct 4: Heard back that they are shipping my order "soon". Some hope comes backHello ___,Thank you for taking the time on sending us an email regarding your Contigo¬Æ product. We do apologize for the late response, we are having email backlogs, but we are working on it diligently to respond to queries right away. The drinking seal plays a big role on the lid and yes! without it, it would leak and we do not want you to experience more of it. We want to ensure you continue to enjoy our drin-kware, and we are sending you a replacement lid at no charge, your order number is ____. Please allow 7-10 business days for processing and shipping. Our stock levels change rapidly, and we may have to replace your product with the same model in a different color. Please do not discard of your defective item until your replacement arrived.---------------Dec 2: NOTHING. So sent them another email------------Dec 15: No response. Just blank radio silence----------------------------The lid on this is somewhat flimsy. But it is astounding for this company to think that someone will wait for 4 months for a warranty replacement. Lesson learnt. My reviews are typically pretty positive, but wanted to warn others. Stay away.
title: HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE

author: Maria C. Cruz
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2021
review_content: This is my third Contigo mug of the same style, but my first stainless steel.  My first one was red and I put it in the dishwasher.  Bad idea!  Most of the red came off.  It still worked just fine and I had it for over a year before I decided I wanted a new one that looked pretty, so I bought a blue one.  I never put it in the dishwasher but eventually the blue started to peel off anyway.  Again, it worked just fine so I continued to use it until the push button on the top broke off.  I could still use it, it just hurt to push against a jagged little piece of plastic in order to drink, so now I ordered the stainless and hope it continues to look great for a long time.  Pros:  1. My first two mugs kept my ice water nice and cold all day long.  I don't drink coffee so I can't comment on how long it keeps hot liquids hot.  2. It is absolutely spill-proof!  I have never had one single drop of water leak out from the mug.  3. It is very easy to drink from it while driving, nothing to "flip up."  Cons:  Well, I wish that the pretty colored ones wouldn't get ruined just through regular use.  That was a disappointment.  I can't really blame the manufacturer for the push button breaking off.  It was several years old at that point and nothing lasts forever.  I love how Contigo works and I've seen nothing else better out there, so I'll stick with the brand.
title: Love Contigo!

author: bizperson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2020
review_content: I'm a little late on this review since I bought it in August 2019 but I have been wanting to write a review. The first Contigo Autoseal that I got really had a strong chemical smell even after I washed it in the dishwasher multiple times. Before I called Amazon customer support I went to my local big box store and smelled about 30 Contigo Autoseals that were on the shelf. None of them had any smell at all. After that I knew that I got a defective product and it seems that there are a small percentage of people that have also received a smelly item. If you buy one of these, check it right away for chemical smells in the lid and return it for a different one if it does smell. Don't even try to wash it because if it smells like chemicals, that smell will not go away even after multiple washings.On the good side, this thermos does a really great job of keeping hot liquids hot and cold liquids cold. The top is a really ingenious invention to seal and an pour. With hot liquids, be careful to push the button before tilting the bottle. See other reviews for more info on this issue. I down-rated this from 5 to 4 stars because of the problems that I had with the chemical smell but I'm happy that Amazon customer service resolved the problem right away. Overall, I would recommend this product and consider it the best sippy cup for adults.
title: Check it for chemical smells when you get it.

author: Univice
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2021
review_content: I have two of these 20 oz Contigo Autoseal Stainless Steel Mugs that I've used regularly for about seven years, and they're still working great with some wear to show for it. Just bought a third to fit my particular needs. It's the perfect size for when I make coffee, and will hold a 'venti' size drink from the coffee stand. It doesn't spill, and it's easy to use with one hand. The lock works well to keep the cup from accidentally releasing If in a situation where the button might get pushed inadvertently.The non painted one (stainless outside) shows least wear except it lost its bottom plate some years ago (without affecting performance), the purple one really only shows paint wear around the bottom corner edge. Now I have this brand new black one.I think people that have problems with the lid being smelly - maybe aren't letting them dry completely between uses. Every time I finish using one, I open the mechanism inside the lid (per instructions), rinse with hot water spray, shake it out and let it dry while staying open and off the cup. I don't reassemble them for any kind of storage until I'm sure that everything is dry.But as I use my cups regularly, I rarely assemble the lids tightly on them while not in use.On the other hand if you felt the need to really get the entire inside of the lid spick and span you probably would have to use some sort of soaking solution because it is difficult to get every part of the mechanism mechanically wiped. But as I only drink black coffee or espresso from them, I don't have to worry about creams and sugars spoiling, or various flavors affecting other drinks.

author: NYCity/Country
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2018
review_content: At last!  This is the one!  It's my 4th try for a travel mug that actually holds 20 oz (yes, a venti) AND does not leak.  First I got a "20 oz" MalloMe.  Seemed nicely constructed and came with accessories.  HOWEVER, it barely held 20 oz WITHOUT the lid, and with the lid, maybe it held 18 oz if it was lucky.  So, then I tried a 22 oz Simple Modern.  Very nice looking.  I sprung extra $ for a lid they said didn't leak (I think it should come with it automatically).  Never mind, because I thought the extra 2 oz would leave space for the lid and I'd have my 20 oz.  Unbelievably, I measured the space the lid took and it seems it only held 16 oz!  I hope I made a mistake, but I can promise you, it's not 20.  So, finally I moved to the Contigo.  I'd been concerned about reports of difficulty cleaning the lid, but the newly engineered lid reportedly had resolved that problem.  At first I bought the 24 oz given my previous experience, but then a kind Amazon customer answered my question telling me this lid doesn't take up room in the cup, so I ordered the 20 oz.  Both came today.  I measured and the 20 oz actually does hold 20 oz AND leaves some room to spare!!!  Holy moly, a travel mug that says 20 oz and actually has 20 USEABLE oz!  Then, with the mug/bottle filled with water, I put on the lid, turned the mug sideways and upside down shaking it vigorously and NOT A DROP of water leaked out!  Wow.  A mug that really performs as advertised--at least in term of volume and being leakproof.  Tomorrow I'll see how it keeps my coffee warm, but I'm sure I'll finish drinking it long before it gets cold.  I really wanted this as much to stop dumping cardboard cups into the environment (I was recycling the lids, anyway, but no lids at all is still better).  I'm thrilled.  If anything changes, I'll post an update.  As far as the 24 oz, I'll probably swap it for a 30 oz, because in really hot weather I drink a lot of cold water or tea.

author: L. Darwin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2020
review_content: My husband received a Yeti tumbler for a gift, but I prefer my Contigo any day. Besides the obvious need to keep drinks hot or cold for long periods of time, the next most important feature is that it be spill-proof and lock-able. Contigo is perfect for this. I'm on-the-go all the time, and I'm accident-prone, as well. Never in all the years of owning Contigo travel mugs have I ever had a leak. His goal is to down the caffeine. Mine is the "experience" of holding and sipping on a warm drink. If  you treasure your hot beverage rituals, and also want to make sure you don't leak or spill, look no further than a Contigo. The models and varieties change over time, but the quality is always very high. The best deals on these, by the way, are usually found at Costco. At my particular location, however, these are seasonal. The only reason I have to replace these is NOT because they fail to perform, but rather because I have a knack for losing them, since I have one with me nearly all the time!

author: DRM
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2019
review_content: UPDATE:  I bought a bunch of these for Christmas gifts for my co-workers. I feel really bad because I hadn't tested the lock first. I had one left over and decided to use it that is when I discovered how incredibly hard the lid button was. I ordered several more in different colors thinking that maybe it was just a fluke on that color but NO. The black and stainless 16 oz lids are very hard to lock and unlock. I returned all of them. He said there were tons of positive reviews and everyone raved about it. His big sell to me was the fact that I can put it in my purse or backpack for work and it doesn't leak. This is important for me because I have to walk a while from my car to the building and when it gets to single digits, I really don't want to carry a coffee cup in my hand. It really does not leak in my backpack or purse. It does get a little hot near the top but I welcome that heat!! I have since bought 4 more of these and absolutely love them. I do have some advice though.1. Make sure to buy the newer model so you can disassemble the lid and throw it in the dishwasher. Once you have filled the vessel with hot coffee or tea... and put the lid on... before you lock it... push the button as if you were going to take a sip. This coffee mug I mean.. not the mishaps.

author: LemurTech
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2013
review_content: My previous travel mug was a Thermos Sipp 16-Ounce Vacuum-Insulated Travel Tumbler. Consider this a brief comparison. Both are similarly priced. The Contigo has a nice, firmly-molded handle, whereas the Thermos is a handle-less tumbler. I've been using the Contigo for about 2 weeks now.While both items have a 16-oz capacity, the Thermos actually holds a little more than the Contigo. It also has a heavier feel to it, and in my estimation keeps drinks warmer for a few hours longer. I have had it fall off a motorcycle at low speed (several times) and survive to be used again. I do not think the Contigo would stand up to the same test--leastwise not with that plastic handle!Where the Contigo absolutely shines is the easy-clean auto-seal mechanism. It is sooo much easier to clean than the Thermos ever was with gunk collecting rubber O-ring seals. The drinking holes and overall ambidextrous design of the Contigo lip are also superb, much better than the Thermos!Aside from the lighter weight and the reduced insulation, my only criticism of this mug is that it doesn't seem all that resistant to scratches. I made the mistake of getting the 'gunmetal' color when I probably should of stuck with the plain stainless steel, as I often keep the cup where it jostles with other bits of metal. Mine ended up with some unattractive scratches after the first day of use!
title: A superb mug that is just a bit light, and a little scratch-prone
