author: C
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2019
review_content: 3/6/20 UPDATE: It has been a year and two months since I purchased the mug and the exterior of the mug has started to peel (shown in the 4th picture). Construction wise, the mug holds up for daily use and commute. My guess is the peeling is from being in the drink holder on my backpack because that's the only thing it would have a chance to rub up against. I don't put the mug in the dishwasher and I only use a paper towel or towel to wash the exterior. Not ready to take a star off for that but it's something to keep in mind before purchase.I have had this travel mug for 5 months and have used it almost every weekday and often on weekends. I carry it around in a side pocket of my backpack and it hasn‚Äôt leaked once; not even when tipped on the side.Apart from the bottom, the inside is easy to clean. I can‚Äôt keep the inside bottom clean with a bottle brush but Contigo sells a set of cleaning brushes meant for cleaning these mugs. However, I haven‚Äôt tried them. Also, the inside of the lid stained easily (shown in the 3rd picture) even though I wash it in a dishwasher. It‚Äôs somewhat trivial since I didn‚Äôt buy the mug with the intent to stare pensively at the inside of the lid.If you are a commuter, accident prone, like to juggle your mug or just looking for a solid travel mug, then go with Contigo.

review_content: Commuting to work or school early in the morning has never been easier with the commendable Contigo Travel Mug. Whether you‚Äôre a parent, teacher, or student with a hectic schedule and in need of a caffeine boost, this mug will grant you the power to push through the busy days in life. Thanks to the insulated stainless-steel feature, beverages are kept hot for up to 5 hours or cold for up to 12 hours. There‚Äôs no need for stopping to microwave a lukewarm drink at the office anymore. This mug‚Äôs ability to maintain and control a desired temperature is just one key area of performance.Spill PreventionThis mug features ‚ÄúAUTOSEAL‚Äù technology which automatically locks the lid between every sip taken. There are numerous times this feature has saved me from spilling hot coffee on the floor of my car. I remember one day specifically that I was running late to work and the AUTOSEAL feature saved me from spilling hot coffee on myself. Although the mug is not guaranteed to fit in all cupholder sizes of vehicles, it will fit in most standard-sized ones. However, even if the mug doesn‚Äôt fit in your desired cupholder, this is a miniscule problem since the AUTOSEAL feature will prevent any leakage of your beverage no matter where your mug is placed.Other BenefitsIn addition, the mug allows for easy cleaning as the underside of the lid flips open for accessing leftover residue and is dishwasher safe. This lets your mug stay looking brand new for several months after beginning to use it. My ultimate favorite feature though is how versatile it is. Whether you‚Äôre in the mood to drink something hot or cold, this mug is not made for one specific use; but rather a world of options.I encourage you to make the decision to invest in the Contigo travel mug today! You too will be able to enjoy the various benefits with just a click of button. Mornings don‚Äôt have to be tough anymore with a Contigo travel mug, instead they can be something to look forward to.

author: Alex C
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2019
review_content: I was in need of a new coffee mug and came across this one almost by accident. It wasn't quite the shape I was looking for but the name Contigo caught my eye. I have one of their water bottles which I absolutely love so much that I bought their coffee mug based off that. That mug itself is quite nice on its own, and I think it's great for several reasons:-It has a slim base so it should fit in most cupholders-Vaccuum sealed so stays hot for hours (way longer than my old mug)-THE LID! Seriously the lid is the best part! Firstly it has an autoseal button so you don't have any chance of spilling plus it keeps the heat in between sips. No more fiddling with a spin tab or flipper top. Just depress the button with each sip. It also has a slider lock if you want extra security. Secondly, you could drink out of the "left" or "right" side of this mug without any adjustment. It has an equal size opening on each side, so when you drink from one side the other acts as an air vent. This may not seem like a big deal but I use my coffee mug all day. My end table is to my left when on the couch, so I drink left handed. On my commute I use the cup holder so I drink from my right. At work I'll do either depending if I'm using the computer or not. With my old mug I would constantly turn the lid so the opening was on the proper side. I didn't realize how much more convenient this type of lid is bc I didn't even know it was an option!Sorry for the long review, got carried away. But essentially if you want an easy to drink from mug that's secure, keeps your drink warm, and looks pretty cool too then buy this.
title: Drinks stay hot for hours, secure, and are easy to drink from this stylish mug!
verified: Style: HandlePattern Name: 1 1 Count (Pack of 1)Color: GunmetalVerified Purchase

author: DAC
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2019
review_content: The item works as described but you need to be conscious as you drink.  If you are a dingbat, like myself, you must remember the drink from the hole.  IE I have pushed the button and tried to drink from the same side I am pushing pouring coffee all over myself.  Hahahahaha.  Ok no points taken away. 100% my fault.  It's pretty clear and a point is obviously I should not be driving a car if I cannot figure out where the liquid is coming from.One reviewer was complaining because it did not fit well in the cup holder in her car.  Nice lady but not much more than me in the logic department I guess.  She showed you three other items she placed in her cupholder.  Not one fit properly.  The soda can too loose and the others all some issue.  Basically a terrible vehicle cupholder.  My cupholder has three rubber pieces at the sides bottom about 2-3 inches up.  It locks anything in beautifully.  Blaming the unit because the car sucks is silly.Lastly I found it isn't very good at keeping the coffee hot.  After 45 minutes it's luke warm and it was almost too hot to drink initially.Lastly after about a year of using the cup about once a week at most meaning some weeks no times a week I find the flow is diminished.  It seems related to the little rubber stopper over the drink hole.  Now in my case this may be a positive since less coffee will pour in my lap if it's not a free flowing.  This also speaks well of it not being as hot after 45 minutes since again when pouring coffee in lap better lukewarm then burning hot.All in all it is a very good product and I recommend it.  I took a star off of cleaning because it does not truly allow you to expose the rubber stopper section for cleaning.
title: Good item.
verified: Style: No HandlePattern Name: 1 16ozColor: Stormy WeatherVerified Purchase

author: Daniel
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2020
review_content: I have two small children - a toddler and an infant. These mugs are a miracle for my wife and I. When we make ourselves coffee in the morning, we aren't always able to drink it all right away, depending on what is happening with our children. These mugs seriously stay warm forever! I'm writing this review at 3:00pm, and my coffee that I made at 8:00am is still warm (obviously not hot, but not lukewarm either - definitely pleasantly warm.)They also are amazing for spill proof. My toddler loves to grab our mugs and teeth on the lids. We've never had a problem with any coffee going anywhere, though. Pre-pandemic, my wife threw this into her backpack or her purse when she traveled to work, and never had any issues either.The silver are the best to get. The colored options are all cool - we had a black and a blue, too. However, it's not a great idea to put the colored ones in the dishwasher - the paint will start to chip and break off. It's still totally usable, but it definitely no longer looks good. However, you don't have the same issue with the silver - it's just the natural metal color, so no flaking or anything when running the whole mug through the dishwasher.I've also found these mugs great for bottle feeding on the go. Both my kids have liked warm formula. With this, we can easily bring along warm water with us, and then fill the bottles when we're ready to feed.These also fit in our Keurig. I'll be honest, I don't remember which model we have, so I know that's probably not sure helpful. But we just need to remove the drip pan on the bottom, and these fit right in.End of the day, they are amazing mugs, and I highly recommend them!
title: Incredible mug - stays warm, doesn't leak
verified: Style: No HandlePattern Name: 1 16 OunceColor: Stainless SteelVerified Purchase

author: Dumb Luck
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2019
review_content: I‚Äôll start by mentioning that I had a previous iteration of the Contigo 20 oz stainless travel mug, you know... the one that‚Äôs a PITA to clean. Even so, I loved that darn thing. It kept my tea warm for hours, even in front of a running AC. It was just the right size for my small hands. I‚Äôd had it for about 10 months before I accidentally closed the car door on it. (Insert sad trombone)In researching a replacement, this seemed to have all the same features with the bonus of being easier to clean. NOT SO. My tea is ‚Äúwarm enough I suppose‚Äù after half an hour, but definitely not HOT as with my old mug. The locking feature has worked well, but it sputters and dribbles all over the place when I open it. I absolutely cannot drink from this, especially on the go. I‚Äôve been using it as a storage thermos and pouring into a separate cup, but even so I have to have napkins around when I set it back down. The final straw was this morning when I didn‚Äôt time the sequence of pressing the release and tipping the mug EXACTLY right, and hot (or maybe it was just ‚Äúwarm enough I suppose‚Äù) tea sprayed all over my desk and myself. Of course, I was wearing a white blouse. I give it one star for the lock and one star for the ease of cleaning.Back to endlessly mining the internet for reviews of the next mug...
title: As long as you don‚Äôt plan to DRINK from it
verified: Style: No HandlePattern Name: 1 16 OunceColor: Radiant OrchidVerified Purchase

author: Linda R
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2020
review_content: I love these things. If you want a cold (or hot) beverage hours and hours after you first poured it, Contigo is the way to go. I can't believe how long their mugs maintain the temperature of whatever you put into them. It is truly amazing.However, I noticed that some were 14 oz and others were 16 oz and that the latter seemed to always cost more. When I ordered a 14 oz though, I found out. The reason is the mouthpiece (where the cup touches your mouth). Anybody who's had one that's a few years old knows that there's a recessed area at that spot that causes the liquid to go out of the cup and down the sides of your face. You have to kind of purse your lips a certain way to avoid wearing your drink if your on the go. (Sitting still isn't that much of an issue.)My reason for returning this is that they failed to mention that in the description. I already have a 'dribbler' cup. That's when the fact that they sold mugs so close in size (14 and 16 oz) started to make sense. They obviously know about their design flaw in the earlier models and fixed it. But they really should let folks know. So, for those of you who think you can ride your bike on rough terrain, or even on your patio, without spilling anything on your shirt when you take a one-handed drink, think again. It ain't gonna happen with this style Contigo. Forget about going with the cool black color and start getting friendly with 'plum' or some other stand-out, and spend a couple of dollars more to get the 16 oz size with the newer screw cap design that does not dribble---nor make you do it either. And watch out for the difference between the "Autoseal" and the "Snapseal." The 'Auto' seals itself and is truly a godsend. The Snapseal has to be manually closed in order to be spillproof. Otherwise it pours out like any other glass of liquid does when it tips over.Shame on you, Contigo!
title: No new opening on 14 oz Contigo
verified: Style: No HandlePattern Name: 1 1 Count (Pack of 1)Color: White MarbleVerified Purchase

author: PASSTHEAMMO
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2017
review_content: As far as a water canteen or a black coffee or perhaps tea mug works great.  I ordered 2 of these and 2 of their snap seals - ran into a couple concerns that Contigo was forthright about their "no milk" products because of the bacterial risk in the hard to clean seals of the lids.  The 3 stars because this to me is a design flaw.  If you know the products have bacterial risk for a common product it is used for - need to change the design.  I only drink black coffee, but on the days off and cold mornings I want to put a double shot of Bailey's, or some Eggnog Liqueur in - I don't want mug preventing me from doing so.  I have upgraded (HUGE upgrade) to Stanley one handed mugs.  Was so happy with the ease of their lids design and cleaning, all dishwasher safe (even the stainless steel and baked enamel coated bodies), that I have ordered almost 20 of them for the families Christmas stocking sufferer this year.  I now only use the Contigo's for my nightly water bottle next to the bed, truck, or around the house.  Good cold / hot retention but nothing that can grow bacteria is a huge downside and the lid designs are not nearly as easy to maintain as Stanley.
title: Definately Not a Stanley

author: KAT
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2020
review_content: I wanted someone to compare these two different Contigo cups when I was purchasing, but no one had compared them; so now I‚Äôll do it.  The ‚ÄúTransit‚Äù model is prettier in my opinion.  The twirling cover is a nice feature.  But  sadly, I don‚Äôt like it as much as the ‚Äúwest loop‚Äù model.  It‚Äôs about the mouth piece.  With the ‚Äútransit‚Äù model, you have to slurp to get your drink into your mouth.  With the ‚Äúwest loop‚Äù you just tilt and suck it in.  No slurping.That being said, I bought these mugs so I can drink Mio flavored water without my kids knowing I have flavored water in there.  I have only drank cold beverages from these.  If, however, I was going to drink something hot (hot chocolate), the slurping from the ‚Äútransit‚Äù might be better because it would allow me to test the heat with my upper lip prior to drinking.  I don‚Äôt think the ‚Äúwest loop‚Äù would allow this as well and one might be more likely to burn one‚Äôs mouth.I purchased 2 ‚Äúwest loop‚Äù contigos after my initial trial of the two cups.  Size wise, I‚Äôve really liked the smaller 16oz over the slightly larger 20 oz.  It fits under my fridge tap better than the larger size. The 20 oz is fine as well, but it‚Äôs a little harder to see what I‚Äôm doing when filling it because it doesn‚Äôt quite fit and has to be tilted to go under the fridge tap.  Hope this helps!I have used the flip up straw contigos for years, but I have doubt that I actually prefer the ‚Äúwest loop‚Äù mug even for drinking water over the straw versions.  The reason is because I felt like I had to unscrew lid on the flip top straw Contigo a little in order to not have to work at getting a drink of water because of the seal on the flip tops doesn‚Äôt allow enough air, so I would have to suck really hard if I didn‚Äôt vent the lid.  The ‚Äúwest loop‚Äù mug just does what I like better.
title: Great product, though does occasionally bead at the seal

author: Birdie Kount
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2018
review_content: I just read a review that said "Don't believe the nay-sayers, but it!"  Well, sorry, but I have to say don't believe the "yay-sayers", as it were.  This mug is terrible and I wish I never bought it.  It leaks, gets nasty inside, is finicky to clean, and -- the worst part by far -- just does NOT keep coffee hot.  I think the reasoning is the lid is "hollow" if you look inside, so there's quite a bit of space, like 1" or 1.5" vertically, from the lip of the actual steel mug to the top of the plastic lid, where it isn't "vacuum-sealed" or "double-walled" or whatever.  So there's a lot of heat transfer through the cheap, thin plastic lid.  I've had other travel mugs in other brands, Thermos mostly (whose lids all broke, I hate those too) but they kept the same coffee WAY hotter for WAY longer.  My new idea to try is I just bought a small double-walled HydroFlask type bottle to function as a thermos with a wide mouth, so I'm going to try that (it's coming today actually!).  So hopefully that works.  But PASS on this mug.

author: Just Mike's Opinion
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2021
review_content: This is the fifth 14 oz mug I've bought.  They are fantastic.  I've had my initial 2 (two) bought from Costco about 2 years ago. author: John W. Lemega
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2020
review_content: This product has 4 deficiencies. First, it does not keep drinks cold for much more than a couple of hours. Second, the lid does not attach easily. Third, the device that opens and closes the aperture through which the stored liquid flows is mechanically complicated and, I anticipate, will fail sooner rather than later. Fourth, hand strength is required to open the cup to permit the flow of liquid, a potential problem for older persons. This cup replaced a 40 year old insulated cup with a simple flip top. It worked well and I discarded it because an outer rubber grip failed.I have been using the cup for 9 months on a daily basis and the "deficiencies" I mentioned may not be such a big problem. The cup has worked well, keeping liquids both hot and cold. The mechanical complications I complained about turned out to be nil sig. The cup is easy to clean and absolutely does not leak. The only potential problem that remains is the need for hand strength to operate the lid. If you suffer from arthritis or other hand weakness, I recommend against purchasing this cup. Notwithstanding my prior review, I now believe this to be an excellent product and will certainly purchase it again.
title: Too Complicated

author: Ron Ramsey
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2019
review_content: 1st off, it does keep coffee hot as long or longer than most. It "looks" nice. But! It's really not very practical or versatile.I don't like it for the following:1. A special "technique" is nec. while the coffee is still hot. Pushing the button 1st before tipping is a no-brainer. no problem here, but the lid is so much taller than others & it's impossible to tell how much to tip it to get a sip. Then, when it does come it's HOT. My other mugs allow some warning, or I can "slurp" a little to avoid lip burn. After an hour or so, this is not so much of a problem.2. Mine is the 20 oz. version, so it won't fit in most single cup makers & the top is quite small so 2 of my pour-over set-ups won't work.3. Straight diameter with no real flair at the top means that, although it might fit in most car cup holders, it won't work in ring type holders that don't have a bottom.4. Lid is tricky to get on right. The instructions explain how to do it. I was an aircraft mechanic all my life, so I know about how to start fittings to avoid cross- threading, but it still takes a few tries sometime & then you still don't know until you do a test tip. (pain in the neck)  I don't have any issues with cleaning. I have not experienced any strange smells. When the lid is really on correctly,it has not leaked a drop anywhere, regardless of angle. It keeps things hot a long time. But I don't enjoy using it. I have others that let me ENJOY my coffee.
title: PROBLEMATIC! Read the negatives before you buy.

author: J.H.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2016
review_content: Posting a 1-star to make sure people will see it.  TL;DR: they changed the material and/or construction of the bottom half a few years ago, and the mugs no longer insulate as claimed.I got one of these before they had the sliding lock on top of the lid release, and it was one of the best products I have ever owned.  As a religious coffee drinker who is always rushing in the morning and never certain when I would actually get to finish my coffee (based on a hectic work schedule) this mug ensured it would be hot as long as I got to it by lunch time.  I was so happy with it I (ALMOST) shared it on my social media outlets!It checked all these boxes for me:- spill proof unless you really dropped the wrong way- open handle allowed the mug to fit most cupholders and could slide into a lunch bag pocket (If my hands were really full I found I could even hang it on my pants pocket to open a door!)- a BREEZE to clean.  The finish of the bottom has not held up against the dishwasher, but having the top be so easy to clean was enough for me (this is a very function-over-form item for me in case that wasn't already obvious!)- It actually held up to Contigo's claims of all day cold or 4-hour hot drinks.I later bought the same mug for my wife since she saw how well it worked for me.  Hers arrived with the new style lid with the top lock.  The handle broke within a few days, but Amazon replaced it with no issue.  The second time around there have been no issues with the handle, but neither mug ever kept her coffee hot for more than an hour or so.  I still have my original (purchased in 2013 or 2014), and it still works great in terms of insulation.  It no longer holds the rubber stoppers on top of the lid as tightly, but it would still protect from a bit spill and only leak slightly if tipped over.  I don't know what was changed about the newer version, but it's unfortunate Contigo seemed to trade quality for an extra feature (the top locking lid).  To be clear, the new lid doesn't change the insulation properties (I have tested both with my Thermoworks thermometer).  If I use my old mug bottom with my wife's new lid, I still get hot coffee for 4 hours.  If she uses my non-locking lid on her mug bottom, it still doesn't insulate.The locking lid is a nice feature to have, but honestly I rarely use it.  The normal handle release is enough of a spill proof seal for me  (and I'm fine with the seal wearing out with daily use after 2-3 years - I would just replace it that often if I could).  I would much rather just have a mug that insulates as it claims with or without the locking top.  Now I'm stuck hoping mine doesn't break because there doesn't seem to be a viable replacement for it!
title: Change in material/design killed a great product.  Contigo traded quality for features on this one.
verified: Style: HandlePattern Name: 1 1 Count (Pack of 1)Color: GunmetalVerified Purchase

author: Emily
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2020
review_content: Pros:Stainless steel body is dishwasher safe: I put it on the bottom rack while putting the lid on the top rack. Just make sure to press the lever on the underside of the lid all the way back to make sure the dishwasher cleans through all the crevices!The button is easy to manipulate. It takes a minimal conscious effort to press the button to allow for a sip and then a release to stop. I have low energy sometimes and this feature is nice in that regard.I love the fact that it also comes with a toggle lock/unlock switch on top of the lid so that if you don‚Äôt want any liquid coming out for any reason, you‚Äôre covered. I‚Äôve tested this by filling it up with water, locking and turning the mug completely over. Nothing. Super great result!Fits in car drink holders: May or may not fit your car but I‚Äôve typically seen it fit a variety of car drink holdersEasy to grip and hold even with sweaty hands: I appreciate having a mug that doesn‚Äôt start slipping out of my grip when I start getting sweaty palms.Lots of color choices for any personal preference one might haveBudget friendlyHigh qualityDurable and long lastingThis isn‚Äôt a con but a suggestion:I wish the choices besides the stainless steel option would be dishwasher safe. I know the lids are. If the colored mugs could be coated in some safe and secure matter so as to allow for the dishwasher safe feature that would be great. Again, this isn‚Äôt a con. It is merely constructive feedback on my part.I highly recommend this travel mug because it doesn‚Äôt give me any issues and it functions like it is supposed to and then some!I was not compensated for my review on this product. I like to give open, honest and transparent feedback on products I like to try. I hope you found this review to be helpful. If so, please click the 'Helpful' button to let myself and others know that it has helped you.
title: Go-To Travel Mug
verified: Style: No HandlePattern Name: 1 16 OunceColor: Stainless SteelVerified Purchase

author: Sophie Connor
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2020
review_content: It all started in 2014. I was a freshman in college and the guy I was seeing had the plastic cold-water-only version of this bottle. When I first saw it I was confused. I thought the button was stupid and overly complicated. Little did I know this bottle would come to be a staple in my life. On mornings when I was hungover, I would reach out and grab the nearest hydration. This trusty bottle was always there. The size of the opening allowed just the right amount of water though so I wasn't drowning but I also was getting hydrated with the speed and desperation of a hamster post-hibernation. (No, I don't actually know whether hamsters hibernate. Sorry.)Anyway, the button saved me so many times. Often when lying in bed I might drop my phone on my face. The same is true of a water bottle. If I had had just a normal, sad water bottle, I would have spilled water all over my face. This bottle, however, closes the second you release the button, protecting me from the curse of my own weak arms. It was truly a hydration miracle and I brought it with me everywhere.Flash forward to 2016, the dark times. At some point in the computer science building, I lost the bottle. Legend says if you walk the halls at night you can still hear the echos of my screams: "Where are you? I can't live without you! Somebody help me!" My boyfriend suggested that I look online and find a replacement. I scorned the idea, no water bottle could replace my water bottle. He pointed out that the bottle was actually his but I would not hear it.Eventually, when the time for mourning had passed tenfold, I decided it was time to get back in the saddle. I went online tentatively. I thought I was taking things slow, but when I saw that Contigo was no longer manufacturing this model, I was heartbroken. Still, I didn't give up. I went on eBay and was still able to find one, albeit I'm the wrong color. Nonetheless, this new bottle found a way into my heart.We spent many loving years together. Eventually, my bottle was covered in as many scratches as stickers. The plastic began to become dry and cracked. This is no fault of the manufacturer, given that I bought it secondhand and that I used it for four years diligently every day. Also I dropped it all the time. My poor bottle was becoming worse for wear. Nevertheless, no one could replace this bottle in my mind.One day, I opened an incognito tab and went online just to see what was out there. I wasn't expecting to find much, but I saw this. Contigo had begun making the same bottle, but this time thermally insulated. I stared at it for a long time. I read reviews. I put it in my cart and took it out again. Eventually, I convinced myself I would use it for tea. I told my old bottle that it was for a different purpose, that it would never be the same.Alas, I was wrong. I regret my foolish promise deeply, but I had to follow my heart. This new bottle is, in fact, superior. Not only does it keep tea hot all day, but it also keeps water cold and refreshing in the summer. It is two rolled in one, the love child of my previous bottles, and I adore it. Thank you Contigo.P.s. I couldn't fit these things into my story but it's easy to clean and the metal doesn't keep flavors in so plain water tastes good even after it was previously full of smoothie. My only complaint is that it leaks a little at the seam if you don't close it tight enough and you have a hot drink. I think this is because the steam expands the rubber seal slightly. Either way, it gets three thumbs up from me.
title: A part of my life
verified: Style: No HandlePattern Name: MugColor: ChardVerified Purchase

author: Brian Lev
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2019
review_content: I had an older model Contigo travel mug that got caught in a closing car door, and based on my experience I immediately looked for another Contigo to replace it.  I chose the West Loop after reading the specs & reviews of different models, and washed it out & used it the day it arrived. Since then I have used it many times indoors or on short trips, and just finished a week-long vacation that had it sitting on a hot beach with no protection other than the shade of an umbrella.  Even when just used indoors as a convenient drink container, it does not keep drinks as cold for as long as the older model (thus my "hype" comment), but still gives me a refreshingly cold drink after four hours of sitting in (shaded) beach sand, and after eight hours its contents remain cool.  I make sure to screw on the lid carefully & lock it when traveling, and to date have had no problems with leakage.  I hope this one lasts as long as my old Contigo did -- and I will definitely buy another in the future.
title: Very Good Value but Not Quite Living Up to the Hype
verified: Style: No HandlePattern Name: 1 16 OunceColor: Radiant OrchidVerified Purchase

author: Maxine Borcherding
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2021
review_content: I bought this as a replacement for a previous Contigo that I had sadly dripped one time too often, and the bottom became wobbly and the base piece fell off. The old Autoseal West Loop travel mug had sealed perfectly. I could put it in my purse or grocery bag, or stick it under my arm when picking up other packages and never worry about coffee leaking from the top.Unfortunately I have to be a lot more careful with the new one. If it isn't upright in the bag, or if I hold it under my arm as I grab my packages from the car, it will leak a bit. Still, it keeps coffee hot for a long time and I am generally pleased with the purchase (but not as pleased with this one as I was the previous one that NEVER leaked.) Hence 4 instead of 5 stars.
title: Bought this as a replacement
verified: Style: No HandlePattern Name: 1 20 OunceColor: Matte BlackVerified Purchase

author: Rodgers 5
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2017
review_content: I love the Contigo travel mugs.At first glance the West Loop looks like the other Contigo Aria mugs I already owned - once you have it in your hand - it has a wider diameter.Two things to consider and remember if you get this mug.1. The inside of the lid is easier to clean because of the re-design that allows it to be popped open - however - be VERY CAREFUL when you open it - if you accidentally dislodge the inner piece - by pulling and moving to quickly, it is challenging to put back in. I found a video on you tube to help me out and I spent about 20 minutes trying to hold a couple of springs open while carefully clicking the part back in place. I was determined, because it was the first time I cleaned it and I hadn't even used it yet. ARGH! Since I learned the hard way - I open the inner working of the lid with a bit more knowledge - because I don't want to do that again.  I would recommend finding a video to show how to pop open the inside of the lid for cleaning - before doing it. However - this feature would not stop me from buying another. I love that you can open it and really get it clean.Even with my initial oops, I love this mug. It is nice and sturdy, I have found it completely leak proof. I even fill two of them for the day and toss them into my tote bag - they roll around and are rarely upright by the time I get to work - no leaks.2. With the West Loop version, I have noticed that I have to be a little more careful about making sure the lid is really level when I start to turn it to secure it in place. The Aria versions you could just put the lid on and turn and go, but they were really hard to get REALLY clean. This new model is a bit trickier to keep completely level for its snug securing - (not quite sure why, but it does appear to have less threading, so you spin it fewer times and have less room for leveling) - but if you take a moment and possibly take off and on to make sure it is secure - it is worth the extra step. If I could change one thing, it would be how tedious it can be to put the top on properly. If it is not a day that I'm in a rush - no problem. However, any day that I'm in a rush, I usually don't think to level it perfectly and always have to start over with a couple of extra exclamations - mostly because I didn't have time to spend playing with a lid.I still love this mug. It has survived a drop or two - maybe a dent as well, keeps my coffee hotter than expected. It is a nice plus that they are making these mugs in some great colors too.
title: Hot drinks that don't spill - what more could you want? Maybe....
verified: Style: No HandlePattern Name: 1 16ozColor: Bright LavenderVerified Purchase

author: JWJ
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2021
review_content: I rarely have a need for a travel mug/cup but every morning I make a big cup of coffee (~21-23oz)at home and drink it in my home office while I work on the computer, I need my coffee to stay a drinkable warm temperature for a few hours. My current coffee cups consist of several YETI style ramblers and they do the job just fine. However my current travel mug/cup is difficult to drink from while driving, it works but really I was tired of it. So based purely on several reviews here at Amazon I went ahead and bought  a 24oz Contigo Auto Seal West Loop. I looked at it for ~3 days before finally using it for the first time,  I finally got around to using it yesterday morning. I usually pour my coffee at boiling since I need it to stay warm so long. Though the instructions say to let the boiling coffee cool down for 3 minutes before applying the lid. I hated doing this but I let it cool down for 2.5min before applying the lid. I sat down at my desk and took my first sip from my new cup. It was a bit awkward because I had to tilt back the cup further back than I am used to and overall the cup felt quite differently than what I am used to with my YETI style ramblers. But I finished the coffee in about ~1.5 hours and it turned out fine. So this morning I made my coffee and went for a YETI before I  though that I had better try the  Contigo again and that was a smart move because today it already feels like I have owned this cup a long time! Yeah its only my second time using it but I already love it and based on it's reviews and the fact that it is a pleasure to drink from, I am confident this will also be  a terrific travel mug!
title: Really nice insulated coffee cup!
verified: Style: No HandlePattern Name: 1 24 OunceColor: Stainless SteelVerified Purchase

author: Frankie91
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2021
review_content: I bought this travel mug on January 18, 2021. On March 3, I accidentally dropped it on the floor, and the cap broke irreparably in three pieces. This was but the second time I dropped it.There was a time when I expect more of a Contigo mug, but this is the second time a Contigo 20 oz. travel mug broke within three months of the date of purchase; the first one (different color, otherwise identical) broke on January 10, 2021, three months after it was bought - same situation, same breaking points, and it was perhaps the third time it was dropped.Compare this with a Contigo mug I bought in mid-2016. It lasted over four years despite being dropped countless times including falling to the ground at about 30 mph after I forgot that I had put it on the roof of the car while putting something in the trunk! It lasted over a year after that; the only reason why it was eventually retired is that after four years, it no longer held the coffee's or tea's temperature for more than about two hours.I contacted Contigo directly about this but after almost three weeks, I have yet to receive a response.These 20 oz. mugs were good while they lasted, but clearly both quality and customer service have gone out the window at that company.This means only thing: my next travel mug will not be a Contigo product.
title: What happened to Contigo's durability and quality of service?
verified: Style: No HandlePattern Name: 1 One Size (Pack of 1)Color: Passion FruitVerified Purchase

author: Ronald Epstein
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2019
review_content: I am so disappointed!I so much wanted this travel mug.  I spent days researching the Internet for the best-rated mug.  This was the one every website raved about.  I had never been so excited about receiving a product.  After all, I couldn't get through my morning coffee without it going cold by the end of the cup.  THIS mug would solve that problem for certain.I read the Amazon reviews.  Sure, there were a small handful of customers that said their mug leaked.  I thought to myself, "that can't happen to me."  It seemed like I would beat the odds and get a product that was defect-free.When the mug arrived, I was so excited!  Finally, I thought, I could enjoy a cup of hot coffee from the first taste to last.  I poured my coffee into the mug, sealed it properly, and placed it next to me as I read my morning news.Next thing I knew, I was wearing coffee.The mug was leaking.  It was not leaking from the mouth, but from the auto seal. Small streams of coffee ran down the mug as I tilted it to drink.  I had coffee all over me.The mug cap was certainly threaded correctly.  Everything seemed properly tightened.  For the life of me, I could not understand how this highly rated product could be leaking......and then I remembered the handful of Amazon reviews that complained about the same thing happening to them.  This wasn't my fault.I can't begin to tell you how disappointed I am.  I looked at a variety of other travel mugs prior to ordering and this was the one I liked the most.  I had hoped it would have provided me a hassle-free morning coffee experience. Instead, it leaked coffee everywhere.I don't know what else to tell you except to avoid this product.  If you really want it, you can roll the dice and return it like I am now if it doesn't work out for you.  Good Luck!
title: What a leaking mess!  Avoid!
verified: Style: No HandlePattern Name: 1 20 OunceColor: BlackVerified Purchase

author: K. P.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2020
review_content: I decided to write this review because I've been really enjoying this travel mug for over a year now. It took me a long time to find something that seemed to fulfill my needs. First of all, it's the perfect size. It's just enough to fit what I need (and usually more), but still can fit in my car's cupholder or the pocket on the side of my backpack. It keeps your drink hot for a long time, which is great. Sometimes I even use it at home for my tea at night because I hate when it gets cold. It's easy to drink out of too. It took me a day or two to get used to pushing the button to be able to drink - at first I found it annoying, and almost regretted my purchase, but after only one or two uses, I didn't even notice it anymore. It's also leakproof, at least so far. I haven't tested its limits by letting it sit upside down, but I've often accidentally knocked it over in my car or backpack or something, and never had an issue. The ONLY thing I would like to improve is the cleaning. Overall, it's definitely not bad. I've had water bottles and other similar products that have been way harder to clean and have quickly developed mold. Not so with this. I love that you can disassemble the lid so easily by just pushing a button essentially, and that it can go in the dishwasher. The only annoyance is that the bottom portion must be cleaned by hand. Also, now that I moved and don't have a dishwasher, I've found cleaning the lid thoroughly by hand is definitely trickier. I don't feel as confident that I'm cleaning it well enough and getting into all the nooks and crannies. Still, I'm happy so far and would consider purchasing again if I needed a new one. Will try to update my review if anything changes.
title: Great product overall
verified: Style: No HandlePattern Name: 1 16 OunceColor: Stainless SteelVerified Purchase

author: Audrey Wicklander
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2021
review_content: Before this, I would‚Äôve given this cup a 5/5. It was leakproof and sturdy, which is all I really care about. I cleaned it every single day after every use, and especially the top because I know issues with mold can happen on travel mugs. It always seemed clean and fine. Little did I know, there was a huge clump of gray mold that formed between the spring and the mouth opening which isn‚Äôt visible from any angle when you‚Äôre cleaning it. So yesterday at work I take a swig of coffee and I feel a clump of stuff in my mouth. I spit it out in the sink and it was just an absolutely disgusting plop of mold the size of and radius of a quarter, and I threw up. I let the top soak in bleach and the amount of mold that came out was horrifying. I thought what I spit out was already enough! I just threw the cup out. Absolutely would never get this product or anything with this brand again. I wish I got a picture but I was so grossed out and I didn‚Äôt think I would leave a review so I didn‚Äôt think to take one, but here I am.

author: Finikky
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2020
review_content: So I read all the reviews on this travel mug. Some of them put me off it, but then I read one that turned me around. Basically, follow the directions! I bought it for my hubby, cleaned it, per instructions, then talked him through them. Don't get me wrong, he's very intelligent and the instructions couldn't be easier, but he's a man, so the instructions would've gone straight to the trash. Anyway, he loves it. It kept his coffee hot for a long time... well, as long as it took him to drink it, but then he refilled it just to keep it in his desk because it cools too fast in a mug. Given it's coffee, I'd like to put the whole thing in the dishwasher, but you can't, per the instructions. I think it has to do with the finish. The only thing that MIGHT get problematic is that I doubt he'll rinse out the lid after every use and the coffee might end up gunking up the lid, but that's what dishwashers are for. And yes, your coffee will be HOT so, as it says in the instructions, push the button to release the stream before you put it to your mouth. By the way, I also bought the Contigo water bottle, and more than 24 hours later, there is still ice. If there travel mug does the same for hot, I can't imagine why you wouldn't want it!

author: Chan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2021
review_content: I love my new coffee cup! It keeps my coffee warm for 3-4 hours with it being cold out. Note that I don't put scolding hot coffee in the cup, it's at a drinkable temperature. date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2019
review_content: I had to replace my old favorite Nissan coffee cups because they just wore out after years of service. These are very good and certainly even an improvement over my old cups in some ways. They are spill-proof, which my old ones were not and they do just as good a job at retaining heat or cold. My problem is with the lid design. If I don't get them aimed exactly right, the coffee tends to dribble down my chin. author: John & LaRinda Leach
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2020
review_content: My first Contingo mugs I bought 7 years ago at Costco and Ioved them. Over time the of daily use the mechanism broke. I ordered these as a replacement, the reviews were mostly good and they were much the same other than the drinking hole was in a raised mound which for me I liked the safety of the hole in the well in case the liquid was too hot. However, no matter how long I soak and what I used to soak them the plastic had a horrible taste. So I found another mug to get by Contigo that had the drinking hole down in the well and it looked the same other than color so I order it...this one, it is 2 ounces smaller but I like it better.Contigo Stainless Steel Coffee Couture AUTOSEAL Vacuum-Insulated Travel Mug, 14 oz, Black ShellNot only do I like the well-drinking hole rather than the raised mound type I just figured out what I believe the problem is from the taste. author: Brian
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2020
review_content: I bought this as a second mug because I liked my stainless steel one so much. I noticed today when I went to take it out in the morning (I don't use it much these days, so it's been months) that the rubber around the lid / head which you're meant to grip has become sticky. It's rubber reversion, something that happens when the chemicals keeping the rubber at its proper, vulcanized texture start to fail. Same thing happened with one of my PS4 controllers. It's as if you left it out in the sun too long, but all it was doing was sitting in a cabinet.This might sound like a small complaint because, hey, it lasted me four years, but I don't think it's small at all. If you'll forgive me my soapbox, now more than ever we must be aware of what we're consuming and how much longevity / disposability our money buys us. Everywhere around us are things we're meant to buy and discard. In a class I took two terms back, it was pointed out that 99% of everything which is manufactured in the modern world is discarded within 6 months.I understand how corporations work, I get that the profit model of modern capitalism relies on us replacing things, and that a fridge or a microwave can't be expected to last 50 years like they used to. But four years out of a coffee mug before the head becomes sticky and gross to the touch? Make the whole thing out of solid plastic, then. I can't recommend somebody buy a mug like this, knowing that in less than half a decade they may have to throw it out because it's simply gotten too disgusting to use. I want to buy things that last, and when you pay $20-30 for a damn travel mug, you expect it to last.One other quick note. For a long time my mugs were dripping and I thought that was a new and disappointing revelation. It turned out I had gotten the lids switched on the stainless and painted models. But they're identical. They just don't sit quite right if they're not on the mug they shipped with. I don't know what the deal is, but it's bizarre and I don't like it. It further makes me wonder if I did decide to seek out a replacement lid (do they even sell those?) would it even fit, or would it leak as well?I don't know what the answer is for my complaints, but to add "doesn't have grippy rubber anywhere on it" to the list of things I look for in a travel mug. I want to buy a product which will last, not break down so I am forced to add it to the proverbial trash heap and return to the Contigo well to buy another soon-to-fail product.
title: Four years later, rubber reversion
verified: Style: No HandlePattern Name: 1 16 OunceColor: Polar WhiteVerified Purchase

author: D. Lane
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2020
review_content: I have had several of these Contigo (Randolph) travel mugs, never due to failure but to my own rough handling and carelessness.  I have never had a problem with them leaking - ever.  I have noticed that sometimes a small puddle can get trapped on top of the seal if the mug is very full. Just depress the button once and it sinks back inside.  The handle is prone to break if the mug is dropped, again not a defect but my own clumsiness, and what has required more replacements than anything.  I keep getting this one because it is perfect for the car. One-hand operation, does not leak, and has the handle that many models lack.  After a couple of years on the jobsite, the color did start to wear off on the outside.  If you are not working construction or other hostile environments, it will likely be fine for you.I don't think they make this particular model any longer (may be why the colors are limited), but as long as the stock keeps it available to me for purchase, I will keep buying them.
title: Never had a problem

author: CG
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2019
review_content: This is my favorite mug by far and I've tried many, including other Cognito mugs. This thing does not leak, allows for perfect single handed operation and has a great mouth opening. Other mugs leak or have lids that are too hard or cumbersome to open and close. The hooked handle of this model comes in very handy. I'll often hook it onto the bottom of my backpack shoulder strap on my way into work. My coffee stays hot for hours. For cleaning, the handle has aOne drawback of this mug is that the very thin layer of paint will start to come off after a while. Perhaps this is why they recommend hand washing the container, while saying the lid/handle are dishwasher safe. But I put them in my dishwasher anyway. I would prefer they sell an unpainted, stainless steel version to avoid this problem.Note: drips can occur when the gasket and/or rim of the mug are not dry when putting the top back on. This can happen after drinking from the mug and the lid is taken off to refill it. I now dry the gasket/threads and rim before putting the cover back on. With this approach, I have not experienced a leak or any dripping in over 3 years. I occasionally buy new ones because I bring them everywhere and forget them places on occasion.

author: Patricia Musgrove
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2020
review_content: I've had this cup for 2 1/2 months and there's only one flaw so let's get it out of the way early: You can't fill it to the brim or when you put the lid on it will spill out. Boom. Tiny issue but you easily learn to fill it to the right amount within the few refills.Otherwise, I've only cleaned it about 3 times, and it's never experienced mold or mildew buildup(although I only use it for water), never gotten gross except for regular dirt on the outside, and when you clean it, the inside of the cap has a spring mechanism to flip it outward and give easy access to clean all around the inside. review_content: For the last ten years or so my Contego mug has been filled with ice water practically 24/7.  It even sits on my night stand all night in case I waken and happen to be a bit dry. I have two 16 oz Contego mugs that have occasionally held hot coffee or tea. However, the cold water Contego has by far been the favorite. After a full night‚Äôs sleep the water is still ice cold! author: Qubit
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2020
review_content: This is my second Contigo autoseal mug. I love the delicate blue-grey of the "Earl Grey" color. I thought that was all appropriate color since I purchased this one for tea, as my other one is reserved for coffee. There was a small flaw I noticed where the paint is chipped off at the top, but it can't be seen with the lid on. (See picture.)Hot drinks stay hot for several hours in this. author: K. Smith
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2021
review_content: This is my 4th, yes 4th Contigo coffee mug. They are good for about a year and then start leaking. They keep your coffee nice and hard for the first hour, very warm for the second hour, slightly warm after that. Mine is usually gone within the first two hours though so that doesn‚Äôt bother me. What bothers me is that the lids don‚Äôt last more than a year. and I only use it for nine months per year. So I suppose you could say it last me about nine months. I never bother with the warranty because I heard bad things about them honoring it and did not want to go through the hassle. author: TBell

review_content: The Contigo West Loop is a great looking mug that does a passable job of keeping coffee hot-ish. author: Me
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2019
review_content: This travel mug is completely leak proof, just like they claim. That's not the problem. The problem is that whatever genius designed this cup used very thin plastic for the lid where you sip from. In addition, the lid isn't concave at all, it's almost completely flat. author: DR
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2019
review_content: The travel mug holds heat or cold extremely well for an extended time,  but it must be used with extreme caution if you put hot beverages into it. The reason is that the engineering design failed to consider the need to vent the hot beverage when pouring from the spout.  I have been actually burned several times when attempting to drink hot coffee from it because high temperature steam at the top of the liquid pushes itself out the spout ahead of the liquid.  Other types of mugs either don't insulate so well or have a vent in the top to release steam and thereby avoid this risk. Moreover, the seller provides NO WARNING OF THE RISK OR CAUTION ON ITS USE OF ANY KIND. Troubling.Separately, repeated use wears on the screw top lid which should have more threads for securing the top. Therefore, you have to be very careful screwing on the lid less it fails to screw on correctly.  Cleaning  is easy if you had a clear liquid in it; but if you use it with a "smoothie" or any beverage with suspended solids, it is not so easy because particles lodge in the opening mechanism.I would not recommend this product even though it retains the temperature of its contents well.  At the least it needs a warning label pertaining to use with hot liquids.

review_content: I'm not going to return this because it's just a 'buyer beware' type thing but I really despise the design. review_content: I am a heavy tea drinker, but I also drink coffee and everything else in these things.  It seems that it is the "tea" that stains them. I have purchase three other Contigo's, this one lasted under one year; then I had to throw it out.  Since I had nothing to loose, I even tried abrasives and still could not get the stains out of the interior.  It was rinsed and/or hand washed, with mild dish soap, multiple times daily. I had purchase the identical item 1.5 years earlier before I had to throw it out for the same reason.Contigo started making ceramic lined alternatives about six months ago: they don't seem to be very popular?  I was able to pick one up on the cheap at a main, brick a mortar, competitor. I have been using it for about three months and have zero issues with it. author: Fred K, Sacramento
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2019
review_content: Keeps cold drinks cold, hot ones hot for really on periods.  It's easy to use and completely leak proof when the lid is properly attached.  I'm a Coke Zero addict, so my Contigo is always filled with Coke.  The Contigo is black.  I left it half filled in my locked, windows-up car in triple digit heat for three hours.  When I finally got back to the car and took is sip, the Coke was still chilled enough to be quite refreshing.  I simply don't understand the few negative comments about mold and smell.  The lids are dishwasher safe. After putting my lid through the dishwasher it does not smell and is sparkling clear--even under flashlight inspection of the hard to reach spring area.A couple of tips for any other carbonated drink lovers out there: (1) Pressure from the carbonation can build up pretty strong, especially if jostled around.  Therefore, you should be mindful to "burp" the Contigo every so often if you have not been drinking from it. (2) To keep my CokeZ extra cold, I make ice cubes from the Coke and add those to my Contigo when I fill it.  That way, not only does it add to and prolong the chill, it prevents the dilution that would come from adding water ice.

author: Mark Schauer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2016
review_content: For some reason, my review of this has been removed. I will have to write a new one.At first, I liked this travel mug. While it does hold its claim of keeping your beverages either hot or cold, the mug itself is what bothers me. More specifically, the lid. I do not recommend using this mug for multiple beverages. The plastic lid tends to hold the flavor of whatever was in the mug before it. For example, one day I had coffee in it. I washed the lid thoroughly (even soaked it in mildly soapy hot water, like it suggests), and the next day I decided that I wanted cold Kool-Aid. When I went to drink from the mug, (I tend to suck in a tiny amount), I was blasted with a plasticy-coffee-y taste, and it really wasn't pleasant. The only way to counteract this is to blow into the mug while drinking, and that can be a bit confusing if you know what I mean.Other than this annoyance, the mug itself is great. It keeps my hot beverages hot and my cold beverages cold. Perhaps I need to purchase several mug lids and ensure that I only use one beverage per lid. That way, I won't have to worry about flavor holding amongst beverages. I don't plan on purchasing more lids, however, because that really ruins the convenience of a travel mug. I also understand most of these mugs are designed with coffee in mind, and if you only put coffee in it, you won't notice the flavor holding because it'll just taste like coffee. But if you put any other drink it in, you will taste whatever was in it before.I hope, in the future, a new all-metal lid comes out from this company. If they use aluminum throughout, then it will be nearly impossible for flavors to hold, and I'll be much happier. I'm only going to remove one star from this review because otherwise this mug is great. As other reviewers pointed out, be sure and get the stainless steel variant because they seem to be having issues with their paint chipping.
title: It keeps my beverages hot or cold for hours, but the lid holds flavors

author: bandparent68
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2018
review_content: These mugs are awesome!  I requested a couple of the 16 oz. mugs as Christmas gifts last December, and they perform just as described.  My main reason for wanting them was for ice water and they work perfectly.  Water stays cold for hours.  I can put a mug of water with several ice cubes on my nightstand when I go to sleep, and there's still ice in it 12 hours later.  I don't drink hot drinks often so that's just a bonus feature for me.  Tea stays steaming hot for a couple of hours; as I gradually sip it, the ambient air that replaces the liquid in the mug cools down the rest of the tea, but it's stayed warm for up to 6 hours.  The mugs and lids are easy enough to clean, but then again, since I mostly drink water from them, they don't get too nasty.  I frequently add a packet of flavoring to my water (like Propel, True Lemon, or Crystal Light type stuff) and one of my lids has gotten stained inside from a pink lemonade mix, but that hasn't affected functionality.The only negative, if it can be considered a down side, is that the capacity is exactly as stated.  The 16 oz. size holds exactly 16 ounces of liquid to the fill line.  Many bottled waters are 500 ml/16.9 oz. so a full bottle will overflow the 16 oz. size mug, especially if you add ice to the mug.  That's why I ordered the 20 oz. size mug, which works perfectly to hold a bottle of water plus ice.I do wish the 20 oz. mugs came in a wider variety of colors, especially in the matte finish.  I prefer the stainless and matte colored mugs because I feel like I can keep a better grip on them; the shiny colors seem slicker.  But all around, these mugs are terrific!
title: I LOVE these fantastic mugs!
verified: Style: No HandlePattern Name: 1 20 OunceColor: Stainless SteelVerified Purchase

author: CMM
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2020
review_content: Instead of a paragraph, im going to do a few bullet points.***the design of the mechanism is really well thought out.  It comes apart with a press of a button so you can clean it.  And again, one finger snaps it back into place.***The lid flows a lot of liquid fast.  Not common with many bottles that feel like you are begging them to give you your drink.  GOOD for when you have been working in the sun and are thirsty.  Some water bottles seem to dribble the liquid out.  I can (and often do) down a 20oz bottle in 5 seconds with no issue.  The "trigger" that unseals the drinking port also opens an "air valve" in the back.  Really genius.***unlike many bottles that require 2 hands to get access to whats inside by turning the top, opening a port, etc.  These are one hand, pick it up, trigger/hold the button with your index finger, drink, release. now its sealed again.  There is a lock on top that you can also easily switch that prevents the "trigger" from accidentally getting pressed say in a backpack/purse/bag. Simple and very effective design.***lifetime warranty.  I recently found the top of one of mine leaking.  I contacted customer support through the contigo website.  No proof of purchase, just had to take some pics, provide some contact info, etc.  Within 2 hours a CSR had emailed me, asking for a street address rather than my po box I provided and were shipping out a replacement.  NO HASSLE warranty claims.***I have 3 of them now.  One is several years old and still works great.
title: simply the most functional water bottle out there.

author: Pretty Regular Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2020
review_content: I drink coffee while driving to work. You can burn your mouth on this very easily. Here's how. We got Contigo travel mugs before, and we really thought they were good quality, so got two more of these. This model by Contigo has a small difference than my other ones that is a big problem. This product doesn't have a depression (i.e. a small pit or a cavity) that can serve as a reservoir for your sip. (See picture I attached with the good one and this one, the bad one.)  When you sip hot coffee a little bit of that coffee needs to rest somewhere so you can moderate the temperature with your mouth and air at the same time. However, this model doesn't have a place to provide the reservoir to sip, it just goes directly into your mouth. If you drink is hot, you have no way to moderate the temperature before it goes into your mouth. Because of this, this is a TERRIBLE travel mug to use while driving. It's still good if you just want something to serve as a thermos and poor your drink into another cup.

review_content: This was my first time purchasing a insulated mug of any type.I like cold drinks mostly and it is VERY effective at keeping things cool. author: JerryP2375
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2017
review_content: Have some history with different types of these vacuum sealed tumblers. The Contigo, is pretty good, but has a few slight drawbacks that keep it from being great.There is a learning curve with using this properly as others have mentioned. You have to press the autoseal button before raising the tumbler to your mouth & tipping it to drink (to release pressure build-up). As you drink you can't chug on this. You've got to sip as the lid design doesn't allow for a heavier flow of liquid to pour. When lowering it's important to keep the button pressed in to allow any excess liquid to drain back into the tumbler or you could wear a few drops as there isn't much of a ridge along the lip (like a canned beverage) for the excess to go. So it either needs to go back into the tumbler or on you. I personally have found that dragging your upper lip & slurping slightly as you lower it, with the button still pressed, helps to avoid having too much excess liquid. It sounds more difficult in detailed explanation, but you get it much easier in actual usage & after a while it becomes more natural.Despite the learning curve, it does work well as long as you learn how to properly use it. As I said, it sounds more difficult in written explanation than in actual physical usage. One thing that I think would significantly improve the design would be to widen the small ridge along the lip of the drinking hole to allow the excess liquid a place to go to then flow back into the tumbler easier as you lower it after taking a swig. This might be nitpicking, but I think it would greatly improve the design & functionality.As for the other reviews that complain of leakage through the threaded area between the lid & tumbler, I have not had this problem. But in my experience with other tumblers I can safely say that this is generally due to 3 things. 1) Not properly tightening the lid. Either being not screwed on tight enough or over-tightening the lid (this can cause too much torque on the seal itself, warping the seal). 2) Filling too high, which can easily cause liquid to seap through the seal when the lid is screwed on. I've found that you should never fill above the lowest thread line. 3) In tumblers that utilize a gasket seal, it's possible that the gasket becomes dislodged, especially after being cleaned in the dishwasher. I don't physically see a gasket on this tumbler. Not one that could be dislodged anyway. This is a good thing.The ability to lock the seal is a nice feature that I use when my 2yo daughter is around. But I haven't just tossed it in a bag or something where it could be inverted. I have physically locked it & inverted it & shaken it just to see how well it works & it didn't leak. But I honestly haven't tested this feature it to it's fullest extent.Overall I give it 4 stars. Despite the fact that there is a bit of a learning curve, it does work well. If they increased the ridge around the drinking hole however, this would be worthy of 5 stars as it is an almost perfect design.
title: Almost perfect in design
verified: Style: No HandlePattern Name: 1 20 OunceColor: Stainless SteelVerified Purchase

The button is easy and doesn't pose any problems.Overall, the best mug i have purchased, and i have a lot threm. I am going to buy one a bit bigger as i would like the option.

author: JustMe
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2021
review_content: This was a present for my coffee-loving husband, who is notoriously clumsy/unlucky with travel mugs. The ones that survived rough handling seemed to all die and start leaking within a year. This sucker still works! We have the stainless steel version, and it's still attractive, too. (Handwash only.) We haven't really tested how leak-proof it is, although he doesn't toss it in a bag or anything. We're careful not to overfill it, and I wash it out daily by hand. I have tossed the lid in the dishwasher when I think it's not quite getting clean enough--that's my only complaint, that cleaning it even with the little lift-tab in the lid can take a touch longer than a more traditional (and leaky) lid. I kind of cringed at spending this much on a coffee travel mug, but it was worth it.
title: Three years going strong

author: Francine Falk-Allen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2020
review_content: I had a lot of difficulty using this commuter mug because you have to hold a button down HARD the whole time you are trying to drink. When my husband saw it when I opened it up (I loved the color and design), he later told me, after I complained about how hard it was to use, that he knew it was going to be difficult for me when he pushed on the button himself. I have small, somewhat weak, hands, even though I do a lot of household work and gardening. I am returning the mug, very, very disappointed. I realize that I must have a mug with a flip top lid for drinking. It does keep the beverage extremely hot; I had to take the lid off for 15-20 minutes in order to be able to drink it, then screwed the lid back on and found it was almost impossible for me to use due to the button feature.
title: NOT for weak, small or painful hands/fingers
verified: Style: No HandlePattern Name: 1 16 OunceColor: Radiant Orchid Trans MatteVerified Purchase

author: Still Chilly in Colorado
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2020
review_content: This mug definitely keeps liquids hot for as long as I would normally be drinking them, but it's not by any means exceptional. The hole from which you sip is oddly flanked by a very shallow lip. You have to open your mouth wider than you'd expect in order to keep liquids from spreading out sideways past the hole and spilling on you. I find it awkward to get my mouth to seal effectively around this opening to avoid spills. If your liquid is really hot you don't want a big mouthful of it, but you can't sip with a "small mouth" without spilling. The leakproof part is fine and the temperature retention is fine, but the "human interface" design is seriously flawed. I use it without the lid on it and wait until my coffee cools enough I can sip straight from the can. I'll give this away and try something else.
title: Not What I Expected
verified: Style: No HandlePattern Name: 1 16 OunceColor: Stainless SteelVerified Purchase

author: Ronbow
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2016
review_content: I drink tons of ice water thanks to this mug. I always have water with me, even when I go to bed, because I am never worried I will have a spill. In the morning there is still unmelted ice in the mug! You will be surprised how little ice you can use (depending on the starting temp off your drink) for it to last the duration of the drink. Of course, it works for hot drinks as well.I had the older version for years, and the Easy Clean cap is a real improvement. The lock is nice to have, but I usually don't bother. The smooth, handle-less profile is easy to hold and easy to slip in a bag. The push button is ergonomically placed and easy to use. I had the 16oz, but with the amount I drink, 20oz is more convenient. 24oz is just too unwieldy for me.I even travel with the mug (empty when passing through TSA) because I hate being without it.
title: Life changing
verified: Style: No HandlePattern Name: 1 20 OunceColor: Stainless SteelVerified Purchase

author: Nanook
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2019
review_content: I think we own four or five of these things. I wouldn‚Äôt own another travel mug ever. These things are that good. The only complaint is that sometimes you‚Äôll need to leave the lid off for a bit to allow the coffee to cool to a drinkable temperature. We‚Äôve had to replace one lid over the years as the spring got all wonky and eventually broke. I can‚Äôt remember what initially happened. I think it was something my daughter did by accident and we damaged the spring reassembling it. The original mug we bought 4-5 years ago is going strong.I don‚Äôt tend to like them for color items, but for keeping things hot...they are awesome. Always amazes me how long things will stay hot.The 20 oz is a bit tall and top heavy, I wish I‚Äôd never bought it. It‚Äôs a little tall for the center console of my car even. This 16 oz is just right. It fits well in the center console, and isn‚Äôt so top heavy it tips over like the 20 oz. It‚Äôs perfectly sized in diameter as well to fit any cup holder.

author: Christian
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2019
review_content: By nature, we all at some point and time knock over our drinks. I am no exception, and neither are any of my employees that I have bought these for. I took my time researching for certain features that I wanted in a beverage container. Those features were:- Temperature; ice did not melt quickly, or stayed very hot.- Automatic shutoff after drinking to prevent spillage.- Easy to clean and dishwasher safe.- Easy warranty process.In lieu of these wanted features, I found the Contigo AUTOSEAL West Loop. I purchased four of these for myself, two 16 oz. mugs, and two 24 oz. mugs. I have been somewhat disappointed in them and the company as a whole, first I will discuss the pro‚Äôs, and then the con‚Äôs.Pros:- Temperature stays cold with ice drinks, and hot with hot liquids.- When using iced drinks the mouth of the mug is larger then most others making it easy to fit in most normal ice sizes.Cons:- Leaks when ice gets lodged between AUTOSEAL stopper and will literally shoot a small piece of ice at you when it melts some.- Have to run finger around top of seal sometimes to ensure a leak free seal.- Very difficult to clean lid, flaky pieces of your drink WILL accumulate if using anything other than water.- Lid is impossible to put back together if you do try to take it apart.- Customer service lifetime guarantee is very difficult and painful to deal with, they are so backlogged with claims that they make you take pictures and answer several questions about the product that a lot of time is wasted back and forth from all the questions customer service asks. All in all, it takes about 30-45 days by the time you finally get a replacement in the mail.Is all this worth it and would I recommend buying this product? The answer is NO, not with all the hassle that is associated with this product. In the end I am left with a bunch of bottles that I can no longer use.
title: Purchased February 29, 2016 with a Lifetime Guarantee, or is it?
verified: Style: No HandlePattern Name: 1 16 OunceColor: BlackVerified Purchase

author: rett smith
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2020
review_content: i was just washing my travel cup when i remembered being slow to buy it because so many people fussed about it smelling funky.  i remembered thinking that a funky smelling coffee cup would suck.  naturally, i just shoved my nose in both the lid and the cup.  WASH YOUR CUP PEOPLE!  i've had coffee in this cup most of the day, five or six days a week, for the four months i've owned it.  it has kept my coffee and my hand warm all winter.  i am not proud of how i treat it.  it rolls around the seat of my work truck full of coffee.  it has never leaked.  once empty, it rolls around the floorboard of the truck.  it is dinged and dented.  IT HAS NEVER LEAKED.  i don't wash it so much as i rinse it out daily but it only smells in the slightest, and pleasantly of coffee.  IT HAS NO 'FUNK'!this coffee cup has become an extension of me.  it has had a hard four months and i would promptly replace it with the same cup if it were to die the death that it has no doubt already earned.UPDATE: after nine months of abuse the small rubber plunger that opens and seals the mouthpiece has become worn and begun to leak. As with all good things, I wish it had lasted longer. That said, I did not hesitate to look for a replacement rubber thingy. No such luck, but for half the price of the new cup I was able to find a whole new lid. Another satisfied customer!
title: so impressed i actually came back to review it! (Twice)
verified: Style: No HandlePattern Name: 1 24 OunceColor: Stainless SteelVerified Purchase

author: L. Lee
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2020
review_content: Love it. Would buy it again. My favorite style of stainless steel vacuum mug, easy clean, typical Contigo quality. Holds two large mugs of coffee plus creamer and flavor syrup, or three small mugs of strong stuff.Note that it doesn't fit under Keurigs; ours has a removable drip tray and is sitting on a k-cup drawer/stand, so we slide the machine forward so the mug can fit under it. Or use a separate mug to brew coffee, and decant it into this Contigo mug. The mouth is not wide enough for a standard-sized pour-over cone filter; the personal sized one fits (but of course it's hard to make decent coffee that doesn't end up bitter when the small cone is used).This mug does fit into standard car cupholders, but does not fit in the water bottle holders on some of my backpacks. The super sleek sides are beautiful, just a bit hard to grip when I desperately need to open the empty mug for a refill, even when I release the vacuum.
title: Best quality and price for a stainless steel coffee mug for the serious addicts, and beautiful, too.
