author: Debbie G
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2019
review_content: I've gone through several brands and styles and this is the best. The vacuum seal keeps liquids cold or hot for an amazing length of time. It is configured so you easily open to drink from it while holding it in a normal hand holding position, and even better, you can LOCK it closed or unlock it with your hand in the same position. Incredibly easy, you don't have to look at what you're doing at all, it's very intuitive. GREAT when driving. (I had a very similar mug where the 'lock' mechanism was not as easy to do, and once did not lock it and put it in my backpack. Something leaned on the 'open to drink' tab, and it opened to waterlog my papers. Which is why I like the easy-lock feature so much.) The cap has a mechanism that allows for easier cleaning that's great for keeping slime from growing in those little areas. Large mouth allows for easy filling with ice, and cleaning. The stainless steel color can be put in the dishwasher! LOVE this mug! The only con would be that there is no handle or loop should you want to hang it from somewhere, but I have found that all the other good things in this mug make that not as important to me.
title: Best travel mug ever found.
verified: Style: No HandlePattern Name: 1 20 OunceColor: Stainless SteelVerified Purchase

author: Ron
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2018
review_content: I have been searching for a coffee travel mug to replace one I had for many many years that finally bit the dust.  I have tried several others and returned them.  This one is great, and has the following features that I wanted in a coffee travel mug:- Handle, so I can hold it in one hand.  And a hook-type handle so it can be slipped in the water-bottle holder of my backpack- Self-sealing lid so that it doesn't drip and splash.  And one-hand lid release, so I can drink while holding it with one hand and use the other hand for something else (like holding the steering wheel of my car, or the strap on the bus).- A comfortable shape to the drinking area.  I bought several other mugs that fulfilled all the criteria above, but the shape where you sip is weird and coffee ended up dribbling down my chin.  Either they had a lip that was too thick, or too high.  This one is really perfect.Oh, and it keeps coffee really hot, and it doesn't spill or leak even when the car or bus is bumpy and liquid sloshes around inside.
title: The PERFECT mug!  I've really been searching.

author: Bensmom
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2020
review_content: It works as advertised: seals well and retains heat for a long time.  It's also my most well built thermos mug, but unfortunately my least comfortable.  My issue is due to the way I use it, driving and drinking....coffee.  One can only hold it one way to open the lid valves to let the drink out, by fingers wrapped around the too narrow handle and thumb resting on the the release lever.  Holding the mug this way for any length of time leads to hand fatigue and discomfort.  I would prefer a release mechanism that holds the mug open so that I can drink while wrapping my hand around the main body of the mug, not the hand cramping handle.  On the other hand, if you are a sipper who puts your mug down after every sip, you'll be just fine with this item.

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2019
review_content: I really love the color and it holds a a little more than my previous plastic travel mug. Note that you shouldn't fill this thermos up all the way. It does fine and better than my other cup though. I think the bottom will get scratched and paint will chip off after a while but we'll see how the rest of the cup holds up with handwashing only and daily use.6/14/19: I REALLY REALLY LOVE IT still :P I've had no problems with my thermos other than dinging it on things sometimes, so yes the color can chip and the bottom will get scuffed up from setting it down everywhere, so don't expect it to be perfect forever :/ BUT over all it works wonderfully, mines does not leak at all and the lock feature is nice when I toss my thermos into a bag. It does keep my coffee hot for a few hours and warm for longer, but it wont stay hot for 7 hours, that's for sure. Unless you have boiling water in it lol. Over all it's amazing, 100x better than my old plastic one and its held up well and easy to clean. I rinse it out every time I finish my drink and soak the lid in hot water so nothing gets built up. author: Denis Allen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2019
review_content: Contigo is my choice for any coffee mug.  I live in Alaska and these mugs keep my coffee hot on the 6 hour drive from Valdez to Anchorage.  My advice, is only buy this size and this design.  Other fancy designs cost more, are harder to hold, do not have this standard top.  It fits my hand so well, and fits the cup holder everywhere in every car I drive.  You can buy extra tops for this if you treat your mug as bad as I do.  I have had some of the same design for more than 10 year.  I will continue to buy them.  "Why," you wonder, "do you have to buy more?"  Well I've dropped them dozens of times on cement floors or black top, and only every broke the weld on one. My kids take them and leave them at friends houses. This mug costs a bit more than ten bucks and is worth EVERY PENNY.  I'm going to write to Contigo and beg them never to drop the standard design.  There is a cool little lock on top of the lid which prevents accidental spillage from the drinking hole; it locks down the push button.  So you could put it in a pouch in a backpack and not worry about accidentally activating the push button.  This is an iconic mug which has never been imitated or improved on. Take my word; order 2.  I prefer plain stainless because eventually my dishwasher peeled off the colored plastic coating Contigo uses.  For best thermal performance fill with boiling water for 10 minutes first.  That's for 6 hour storage.  Don't do that if your commute is less than 2 hours.
title: Perfect size, and quality is number 1.  Terrific thermal performance.

author: Jeremy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2019
review_content: The caps to these are engineered a lot more than all the previous mugs and such that I have used. There is a tab that you can push to open up the entire cap for cleaning. I want my coffee to cool down enough for me to drink!My only complaint is that it is not 100% leakproof. When shaking the bottle upside down, nothing comes out. They hold my hot drinks for hours in the winter.But I use the ones with the regular snapseal lid. The snapseal lids are solid, and can take a beating and then just look at you like you're crazy.I've had two (2) cups with autoseal lids take a nosedive off my personal vehicle. As soon as they hit the ground, the top breaks and explodes like an ACME product in Wiley Coyote's schemes.The autoseal lids are made of multiple components that are assembled and ultrasonically welded together with a hollow inside to accommodate the self closing feature.Replacement lids can be purchased separately here on Amazon, but it's better to just get the cups with the solid single piece snapseal lid.

review_content: I love this travel mug. I have purchased 3. Two for myself and one as a gift. I plan to purchase several more in the future as gifts as well. It has a lock on the top as well which I haven't found a use for as of yet. I have purchased the Radiant Orchid and the Violet both are very pretty colors. author: Manoj
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2018
review_content: I bought this after I managed to break the cap off my old contigo flask :(.I drink a lot of coffee and always make mine at home and take it to work ( Good quality coffee beans , ground every morning, fed to a Moccamaster to make amazing coffee! ). I wanted a flask that could hold enough for a day and one that would keep it hot at least most of the day. I decided to give this a try after doing a bit of research.First the good news:1. Large enough to hold a lot of coffee!2. Nice sleek looking design3. Slim enough to fit in most cup holders and easy to carry around4. Easy to operate with one hand5. The lock is nice and reliable6. The cap doesn‚Äôt take much space inside the flask so you can fill it close to the brim without fear of spilling coffee while tightening the cap (this is something I really appreciate!)7. It retains temperature very well. The coffee remained hot enough for about 6 hours and was then warm enough for another two ( You will usually run out of coffee by the 6 hour mark anyway!)Now the few cons:1. Since it is slim, it is not that easy to give it a good wash. You may want to buy a dedicated brush to clean the flask.2. The inside of the cap is difficult to clean as well. I end up using a tooth brush to clean it well as the caffeine residue will not come out easily and not all areas of the cap are easy to reach with just fingers or a sponge.3. Since the opening on the cap is quite small, it is not easy to assess the hotness of the drink till you take the first sip or you unscrew the cap. With a generic flask, I could open the lid easily and kinda make sense of the temperature, no such luck with this one. It will take a few days to get a hang of it ( I did get my tongue burnt once or twice)Overall, if the cons sound bad, then it is better to go with a manual seal one rather than the auto seal. Otherwise, go for it as it is a really good flask! I really do like it and will definitely recommend this product!

author: Michael Lynch
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2020
review_content: The mug retains heat for hours and cold even longer. I have experience of the heat retention but have the manufacturer's assertion of its cold keeping powers. The item seems to have a double-walled holder much like the old-fashioned glass thermos bottle (which as subject to shattering if dropped). This one does not suffer from that weakness. The drinking opening is somewhat small which is a strength (for ease of sealing) and a weakness as it is somewhat difficult to get a big gulp. The cap contains some mechanical intricacies to enable the opening for drinking and strong sealing of the said opening. It is, inconsequence, somewhat more difficult to clean well (although I believe it may be run through the dishwasher. ) In all, I am quite satisfied with a travel mug that allows me to have hot coffee several hours after pouring.

author: VW
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 16, 2020
review_content: Whether or not these thermal mugs are good or not good depends on what you want in a thermal mug. What I want is very not coffee for a very long time. We have a 1,600 mile drive ahead of us, so I tested this Contigo out. I pre-heated it with hot water, filled it with coffee, added sweetener and powdered milk and took a sip. Very hot. Then I screwed on the lid at 12:25 and headed to my hair appointment an hour's drive away. The coffee remained hot for the entire drive. I continued sipping at the salons but, by 2:30, the coffee had cooled considerably. One half hour later, it was Luke warm. So, only fairish heat retention. I also think the opening should be a tad wider. Hot liquid feels like a laser beam in your mouth because it is so concentrated.

May be a little bit inconvenient to clean, but totally worth it.For daily cleaning, I rinse, then add a bit of hot water.  Tip upside down, shake, then press button. author: MamaSylvia
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 10, 2018
review_content: I have had this mug over a year now and it is WONDERFUL. I bought the 20-oz stainless version as I don't do hand washing. (The 20-oz cup actually holds 16 oz - more than that and liquid overflows when you put the lid on.) It really does not leak as long as you follow the directions - tighten the lid all the way, press the release button before tilting it to drink. I have added hot tea before bedtime and had pleasantly warm tea when I woke up. I have left iced tea in a car with the hot summer sun beating down and chugged a nice cold glug when I got back from shopping. I flew with this mug - emptied it before going through security, of course, then refilled with cold water fountain water and an instant-drink packet, tossed into my carryon, and had a nice cold drink throughout the flight without paying inflated airline prices. I had to buy a second mug so I had a backup when running one through the dishwasher!Those of you who have read my other reviews know that I don't give 5-star reviews often. A product that simply does a decent job at what it claims to do earns a 4-star rating. It takes something exceptional to get 5 stars from me. THIS MUG IS EXCEPTIONAL. I haven't had any problems so I can't speak to their warranty service. But for my money, if you want a truly leakproof and temperature-keeping travel mug, this is the ONLY choice.2-year followup Oct. 27, 2018: After 2 years of intermittent use, both of the mugs I bought still work great. I tend not to use them much in the house because I don't want to risk not having one clean and ready to use when I am heading out for any length of time and want to take a drink along. They still don't leak, they still keep the contents hot or cold. and when they do finally give up the ghost I know what I will be buying as a replacement!

review_content: I purchased the Contigo insulated mug and couldn't be happier.  This mug will actually keep my cold drinks cold for many, many hours. I purchased one Contigo filled it with a cold drink and 17 hours later it was still deliciously cold. Not as ice cold as In the morning but still cold.  So great, I purchased another.  I now have my caretaker put both mugs, without the tops in the freezer when she arrives at my home.  After we get me ready for the day, approximately 20 minutes before  coffee she puts two of my beverages in the freezer, remembering to unscrew them for easier opening later.  After 20 minutes or so she takes them out of the freezer and pours them into my mugs and puts the lids on. Being careful they don't freeze. If they have a bit of slightly frozen slushy it's even better.  OMG!  A day and a half later one mug still had a mouthful of COLD beverage.  They work equally as well to keep drinks HOT.  Contigo insulated mugs work 1,000% better then the crazy expensive Yeti, trust me.  You won't be sorry.

author: Arnell
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2018
review_content: Historically, I have had great experience with Contigo products.  This product is no different.  The stainless steel build has been dependable and durable.  In regards to keeping it cool/hot, I don't believe it's significantly different than any other high quality container.  I like this model with the locking tab to prevent accidentally engaging the drinking spout.  Overall, this is a great product in the sense of value, durability/build, usability, and real world use.  The biggest issue I have with this product is cleaning the lid.  The container itself is easy to clean, but you really need to make efforts to clean the lid if you use it for anything outside of water.  Some of their products used to come with cleaning brushes for their unique lids, but this one doesn't come with one.  You will need to be sure you have some to properly clean your product.  (Pro Tip:  Soak in hot soapy water prior to cleaning.  Always use a brush for both container and lid.)  Cleaning would be my only hang-up, but for the most part, I would still recommend.  If you don't have any issues with the cleaning difficulties, you can argue this is a 5-star review.  Please use this review in it's context.

author: An observer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2017
review_content: I got two of the 16 oz, "Stainless" color.  What a great find!  It solves 2 problems:  (1) sipping coffee in the morning - I don't have to keep running to the microwave to heat coffee if I drink it slowly, like I would with a regular coffee cup, and (2) sipping coffee while driving - I've been using disposable styrofoam cups/lids.  I'm really impressed with this.  It fits fine in my Volvo cup holder, with room to spare.  It's easy for me to grab (I have small hands).  When I'm driving in the dark, I can easily tell where the spout is going to be because you can feel the large button on the back of the cup that you have to push to open the spout.  With styrofoam cups in the dark, it can be tricky to tell where the opening is.  The design is lovely; it looks pretty.  Just one caution - IF you're going to drink it right away - let your coffee cool off a bit (or put some cold milk in with it) before putting the lid on, because this thing keeps coffee as hot as when you put it in there, and you won't like having your tongue singed.  IF you're going to drink it once you get to work - the heat will dissipate a little after 10-20 minutes, and won't be quite so hot after that.  But if you pour boiling water/coffee, better let it cool before putting the lid on.  --  Also, if you want to sanitize it in your dishwasher, be sure to get the "stainless steel" color and not a painted color, and put it on the top rack.  Plain stainless steel is ok in the dishwasher.  I just wash mine with warm soapy water and use an OXO bottle brush, which also cleans the grooves.  I got two, so I can always have at least one clean and ready to go.  Also, try to rinse them out when you finish your coffee; makes it easier to clean later.
title: I'm really impressed with this!  Solves 2 problems!

author: TinaCat
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 28, 2020
review_content: Best Leakproof Option: I had a Contigo thermos years ago that my dad got me. I loved it, because having gone through so many thermoses and water bottles, I never had an issue with it leaking. I had the thermos for 3 years. It was all beat up but still worked and best of all still didn't leak. Finally, I thought it's time for a new thermos and I had to go with Contigo again.Temperature: Plus it maintains the temperature of the liquids, whether hot or cold, for hours. I do think it maintains the hot temperature longer than cold temperature though. But, I mostly use this for my teas or coffee and use a separate reusable bottle for my cold water.Design: It's the perfect size for holding or throwing in your purse, not too bulky. In terms of drinking, I prefer this one with the lock mechanism on the top, where you have to hold the button down in order to drink. I've had another thermos with the flip top mouth piece and find that I would forget to close it or it will leak if I didn't click it into place all the way. This style of thermos top is much more foolproof as it only opens a hole for drinking when you press the button down. Just be sure to hold it away from you when you go to open it for your first sip, otherwise you'll get squirt with boiling hot tea or coffee on your face. Not pleasant! They include a disclaimer which states that, but I think a lot of people will probably overlook it.
title: Contigo Is Best Leakproof Option

author: Michael Simpson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2019
review_content: I bought this for walking to work in cold weather. My requirements were a) keep the coffee hot, b) don't leak while walking or if I put it in my backpack, and c) allow me to drink while walking without spilling.This thing meets all those requirements. That in itself is not enough to get me to write a review, but this morning, I had the thermos stuck in the side of my backpack. I took off the backpack, and the Contigo flew out and landed hard on concrete - hard enough to knock the lid off thread.  The lid did not come off though. I ended up leaking about a teaspoon of coffee, and the thermos itself wasn't even dented, though it did get a few scratches (see pic).So I'm very happy with my purchase.  Some reviewers have commented on the pushbutton sealing mechanism... it's a bit complicated internally (a pivot, lever and spring that pushes a small silicone pad up against the underside of the opening), but it's easy to use, reliable and durable. If you have a hot drink in there and push the button, you can get a small burst of escaping pressure, which leads to the warning and instructions to orient the thermos properly, yada yada yada. It's simple and you'll figure it out in five seconds. The burst of pressure means that the thermos is actually SEALING, unlike other leakier ones. So to me it's a feature, not a problem.Highly recommended.

author: KTFinzer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2017
review_content: This insulated mug is by far the best that I have used to this point.This is the second Contigo West Loop that I have had.The first one I used for about two years until it broke after some major abuse and a fall at work. As far as usability, I absolutely loved it.The vacuum insulation worked very well, and would keep all of my drinks hot or cold for hours.Probably the best part of the mug though is the leak-proof design. In the two years that I had the mug, I did not have any problems with the mug leaking. This meant that I could take the mug and toss is onto the passenger's seat in my car and go - no need to worry about babying a hot drink or worry about it spilling in my car.I am also a tea drinker so I purchased the optional tea infuser accessory (  Contigo West Loop Travel Mug Tea Infuser Accessory, Greyed Jade          ), which was admittedly a bit expensive, but worth its weight in gold. Just put a tea bag in the infuser, pop the infuser onto the bottom of the mug lid and go. No need to wait for the tea to brew or for tea bag strings to be hanging out of the mug.There are two potential downsides to this mug. First is the durability of the finish. The first mug I has was the Latte color and I found that with regular use, the finish would scratch off easily, and the outside shell of the mug would dent easily if dropped even a small distance. I don't know if all of the colors will have this issue (I assume that the stainless color would not have a "painted-on" finish, for example) but the Latte color one definitely does, as well as my second one, which is black. This is purely cosmetic, however, and does not affect the functionality of the mug.The second potential downside to the mug is the difficulty in sipping hot drinks. The way the mouthpiece is designed, it is a little difficult to sip a very hot drink, as the way the mug handles is more of an "all or nothing" type of thing. This is definitely worse at first until you become used to how the mug works, but it is definitely something to be aware of.Overall though, this is a wonderful mug, and I would definitely recommend it to anyone who needs to carry liquids with them.
title: Awesome Mug!

author: dugzer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2020
review_content: This travel mug is an addition / replacement to my 20 ounce Thermos mug that required a replacement lid due to the plastic threads stripping.  I wanted to try another manufacturer and this Contigo was rated fairly well in the reviews.  Rightly so.  The mug is very impressive and does a great job of keeping the contents either hot or cold for hours.  Coffee will not retain the same temp as first brewed but it does stay hot/warm enough to enjoy for a LONG time.  The lid seals nicely with less than a full turn.  Contents do not come out the opening unless you depress the button on the opposite side so it is great if it tips over - nothing will come out.  The Contigo thermal mug is the perfect height to fit under the Keurig coffee maker to dispense a full 12 ounce.  It can also be filled with more up close to the brim and the top placed on it without squeezing out the excess like my Thermos lid does.  This Contigo Travel Mug has now become my go-to mug of choice over the Thermos which I enjoyed for many years.

author: Bill L.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2018
review_content: I liked the idea and looks of the product, but the top sealing mechanism leaks from the push button area after you take a sip and reseal. I don't usually write negative reviews, but this should not happen.  I don't believe it would leak if you closed the top and never took a sip, but then that defeats the purpose of the clever design.  I'm just not going to take sips, period.  I don't like returning products as I find that wasteful if I can still get some use out of it.Update 7/13/18 - I've figured out how to use this mug without it leaking.  I just have to make sure no liquid is in the top part of the mug when I take a sip.  This might be from the mug having been shaken or tipped prior to the sip or simply from condensation.  Simply tap the bottom of the mug on your hand to shake any droplets off the inside mechanism then operate the push button and drink normally.  Changing the star rating from 2 to 4.  Oh, a bonus tip.  If you close the seal while sipping, you can have the contents partially vacuum sealed and there will be even less chance of internal pressure pushing out liquid when tipped.Update 8/27/18 - Still loving it.  No spills since my initial incorrect use.  I also have no worries with the mug in any orientation in my backpack.  Warm drinks have been staying warm long enough for me to consume the contents.  Cold drinks do stay cold even longer, but I rarely have cold drinks with this mug.

review_content: This is the second Contigo coffee mug I've purchased, so I've used one of these for years (the most recent mug appears identical to the older one). author: LTW
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2017
review_content: Second Update:  I filled out the online warranty claim, received a response within a couple weeks, and a new replacement cup via FedEx within approximately 1 month.  With how happy I've been with Contigo products in the past, and knowing that they stand behind their products, I will definately purchase & recommend their cups again.Updated:  After 6 months of use, my cup suddenly leaks badly.  I've owned several Contigo cups over the years and have never had this issue before.  The first leak that started was with the valve.  When you go to take a sip, the liquid pours all over you.  Later, for no reason at all, (it wasn't dropped or damaged otherwise just before it started leaking), I can longer screw the lid on properly, so the cup itself leaks when tipped (the same issue my daughter had which I assumed was from loosing a rubber seal, but now doubt it was).  I have made a claim under the lifetime warranty on their website and will update once I'm able to get that sorted out and see if they will stand behind their product.  Very disappointed in this cup since every other Contigo cup I've purchased each lasted me several years, which is why I ordered this one, yet this one didn't make it 6 months.Original review:I use it as a water cup but have used it for tea as well (if you use it for coffee, even after washing it several times, it can hold the taste, affecting other drinks.  Will eventually go away, but takes time and effort.  I've found this true for all stainless steel cups). It holds the temperature really well (I've had ice in water last a couple hours and tea too hot to drink 3 hours after filling it).  I've never had mine leak, (there is a guarentee) but my daughters did eventually, after about 2 years of use, have hers leak by either loosing or damaging the seal inside the lid somehow.  The exterior does NOT change temperature based on what's inside, but the exterior colour of the container will wear off over time in the dishwasher, so best to only place lids in.  My last cup lasted me about 4 years with a lot of dropping, leaving it with dents, scratches, and the plate on the bottom popped off, none of which affected its effectiveness at all. My daughter finally smashed the lid at school when she borrowed it and it was knocked off her desk, so I needed to replace it (I think it hit it's dropping limit finally). This cup is excellent quality and is all I buy for myself to use and I highly recommend.
title: Replacement cup was quickly sent after warranty claim

author: LarryB
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2016
review_content: I bought this to replace a 12oz travel mug I had purchased from Starbucks years ago.  That mug got lost and Starbucks no longer carries it so the search was on for a replacement.  My "must have" criteria are: 1) Fit in my cup BMW cup holder (those with BMWs will know this is not easy) 2) keep coffee hot for hours 3) easy access top 4) spill proof.  I had narrowed my choices down to the Contigo and Zojirushi.I eliminated the Zojirushi because of the flip top.  Don't need that in my line of sight while sipping coffee.  Reviews of horrendous customer service and failure to honor the 5 year warranty on failed mugs left this cup out of the running.  So that left the Contigo.I watched a YouTube video where a fellow gave the dimensions of this mug and it looked like it would fit my cup holder.  So, I bought it.  Well, seems they have changed the shape and the bottom is wider now (2 7/8" as opposed to 2 5/8 from the video) and that doesn't fit.  Strike one!  I decided to keep the mug and figure out a way to add an aftermarket cup holder to the car so I could use.  Other reviews said it excelled in my other 3 criteria.  So, today was my first use.  Filled it with coffee around 7a and by 10a it was luke warm....not hot, so can't say I'm happy with the thermal retention properties of this mug.  Strike two.The button for drinking works well and it is quite spill proof.  I'm not going to send it back because I did use it.  I'll keep it as a "working in the garage" coffee mug.  But as a travel mug it fails.

review_content: Ive purchased various sizes & types of this bottle: All used to hold coffee tea etc, typically hot, but also self-made iced coffee, storing *only* the cold liquid. However, the lid's design (which helps storage & drinking) doesn't facilitate easy cleaning. Careful cleaning by hand with a baby bottle brush does not clean all areas. author: Johan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2018
review_content: These mugs are great. I bought 4 already.I travel alot and use travel mugs for coffee or cooldrink. It has happened a few times that when i clean up the vehicles after a trip, and bundle things together to carry back home together, that the mugs turn over and spill a little bit of left over coffee etc on my clothing, bag or car when you think there is nothing left over inside the cup! Or cups/mugs have toppled over in the vehicle when  you suddenly have to break hard, go over extreme bumpy roads (I do all wheel drive 4x4 off-road driving in Africa a lot) etc. This Contiga puts an end to that.The seal is excellent and it stays sealed regardless of the lock being on or off. author: Mark S.P. Turvin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2020
review_content: I've been a fan of Contigo Autoseal products for many years. Each design they have was impressive to me and kept my beverages hot and cold for crazy amounts of time, but always had the flaw of difficult cleaning that kept it from being perfect. I recently and reluctantly had to replace my second generation autoseal mug when I damaged the autoseal gasket trying to...you guessed it...clean it. It had a good run of nearly years, so while I brought it everywhere, I didn't mind spending the money to get a-now-fourth replacement. I'm glad I did. The latest version of the autoseal top has finally found an effective way to make cleaning much easier. The mechanism itself lifts out. That takes away 90% of the problems associated with cleaning. It still requires a pipe cleaner or straw cleaner to clean out the actual autoseal gasket, but the rest of the mechanism is easy to clean. I highly recommend this if you want a thermos mug that gives you long hot and cold times for your beverages, doesn't leak (I have left this lying on my car seat on its side so many times and never had it leak), and is now much easier to clean.

author: Brad
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2017
review_content: After a week of use, I can say I like this cup.  I've previously only ever had Starbucks brand spill-proof cups, so I was hesitant to purchase another brand.  But I was tired of loosing the more expensive Starbucks cups, and at almost half the price, I decided to give this a try.I like the concept of how the spill-proof trigger works.  It opens easily for cleaning.  I can tell that you need to follow the manufacturer's directions of rinsing the cup out right after use, though.  If you've used these spill-proof cups in the past, you probably know the mistake of forgetting that last sip of coffee in the cup and leaving it for a day or five.  It's nasty and you have to scrub the heck out of the cup to get the stank out.  And then throw it in the dishwasher twice.  Well, with this cup, there is the spring in the lid mechanism, there is the hinges of the lid mechanism... all sorts of little nooks and crannies where stanky gunk could get get lodged and really hard to scrub out.  So yeah, I think this cup is great so far, but I know I can't be forgetful like I've been with my old cups.Also, the spill-proof mechanism works very well right now.  I'm worried about so many moving parts that are involved in keeping it spill-proof, though. Time will tell if the spring and hinges will hold their strength and keep the cup spill-proof.  Even my higher-priced Starbucks cups would start to degrade their spill-proof nature as the rubber seals wore down, usually after about 2 years of daily use.
title: Works Great Now - Time will tell

author: Kamaksi ZombieStomp
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2018
review_content: So i have used Contigo mugs for a few years now and although they were one of the better ones on the market a few years back, they weren't the best.  That is until they got to this mug.Yes there is the issue of putting hot water and it spewing out the vents if you open it.  It is basic physics and the expansion of hot gases.  CAPTAIN OBVIOUS speaking here!  I always give it a quick vent right after i close it up tight.  It is just the way things work.Now that being said, this is one tough MOTHER TRUCKER of a mug.  This is not my first rodeo with this mug and will keep buying them so long as they are offered like this.  I constantly drop them and beat mine up and they just dont skip a bead.  They are so TOUGH even a car running over one did not prevent it from keeping my coffee warm.  Yea you heard that right!  i left my mug on the back trunk lid of my VW jetta and when went to pull out of my driveway i ran over the mug!  i got out and it was partially crushed and still kept the coffee in it.  It stayed warm for the next few hours.  It was quite the sight to see when i took it into my classes.  My students got a real kick out of a mug that was run over by a car.  I continued to use it for the next month or two till i finally decided it was time to get a new one!The only faults i can find ( if they really are)  deal with the bottom cap comes off a bit to easy.  I cured that with a little clear gorilla glue.  And the plastic rings get nicked a bit to easy when i drop it in my gravel drive way.  But we know nothing is indestructible and it is what it is!i will (and do) buy more as they just wear out.  I have 2 of my original i got about 5 years ago ( i use every day) and they lost their seal and thy just dont hold heat anymore.  I am guessing the vacuum seal was lost some how!
title: Survived being run over by a car!
verified: Style: No HandlePattern Name: 1 20 OunceColor: Stainless SteelVerified Purchase

author: rob o.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2020
review_content: These things keep your drinks HOT! They did a decent job at keeping liquid in - I've had a lot of hot drink cups that leak way worse, BUT they will spill if left sideways in a lunch bag, in my experience. The big punch for me was that my coffee and tea just simply tasted bad in these containers. I waited a long time before reviewing in hopes that the taste would go away, but it hasn't. They have a smell/taste that is very off-putting in a way that seems like they'll give you cancer, which I'd be Ok with (not really) if at least if the taste of my coffee was preserved and it remained hot. But the fact of the matter is, I don't want to drink anything out of these cups, so I've donated them.

author: Ryan Z
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2017
review_content: Great travel cup! I've used this for both hot and cold drinks and while I'd say it works great I'd also say that the advertised 5+ hours of heat retention is a bit of a stretch. I brew coffee with a¬†  Bonavita BV1900TS 8-Cup Carafe Coffee Brewer, Stainless Steel          ¬†and with temperatures above 180 degrees in the carafe after brewing, it's by no means near that after pouring it into this cup and letting it sit for 5 hours, although it does make a noticeable difference if you preheat the travel mug with hot water before pouring your coffee in. Warm? Yes. Hot? No. I have a 1 hour commute to work and my coffee stays hot enough that I'm still having to sip it once I've arrived. Gone are the days of having luke warm coffee half way to work. I'd say it's probably closer to 3 hours which is plenty good enough for me, I don't nurse coffee for 5 hours, I drink it as fast as humanly possible without scalding my mouth. With that being said, this is BY FAR the best travel mug I've ever owned. Easy to clean, no leaks so far (I've intentionally tried), and great insulation properties makes for a great mug,especially if you're on the go! Bought one for my wife and would definitely purchase again!
title: Great travel mug without the leaks!

author: tammy2013
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2020
review_content: I wish Contigo would switch to 18/10 stainless steel.  I would be a customer for life.  I love the lid design, it is my favorite for travel coffee mugs and I have never had an issue with the mug not keeping my coffee hot.  However, I have now had several of these mugs and the inside metal flakes off after a period of time and when you put a liquid into it, the metal goes into the liquid.  I do not want to be drinking metal flakes!  Today, I poured water in the mug to then transfer to a measuring cup to obtain the number of ounces to order another mug and could see small flakes of metal floating in the water.  I will stick to a Yeti in the future.  I don't like their lid design nearly as much but the metal doesn't flake into my coffee.

author: Chris H
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2016
review_content: I have been using this mug for about 8 months now. I am very satisfied with the performance of the mug, but not in its upkeep.The good: The cup is excellent at maintaining the temperature of hot and cold beverages. The exterior does not collect condensation, and I love using it around the house. The lid is comfortable, and the locking/sip mechanism built into the lid works well and does not spill or leak in any way. It unclasps in a manner which makes it easy to clean to keep the mechanism sanitary.The bad: There is a thin plastic clear coat of color (black) over the stainless of the cup. This is VERY easily scratched, nicked, or dented, revealing the lighter color of the underlying stainless layer. The cup began to look battered within the first 2 months of light use, which was disappointing. Additionally, despite the useful lock/snap opening method of the lid for cleaning, the many nooks and crannies of the sealing mechanism collect residue from drinks over the weeks, and are extraordinarily painful to clean thoroughly. At this point I would have rather the cup lacked the mechanism entirely, and instead had a simple narrow opening on top.Overall: this mug performs well, but its fragile resistance to light cosmetic damage and difficult to clean lid commit too many sins to make it a top of the line product.
title: Good, But Not the Best
verified: Style: HandlePattern Name: 1 1 Count (Pack of 1)Color: GunmetalVerified Purchase

author: SP
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2016
review_content: I got my Contigo Autoseal west loop stainless steel mug today! I was extremely eager to get this as I do love my cup of joe in the morning and the countless of starbucks mugs (that are not worth the money...) have all been thrown out. I also got the tea infuser that you have to buy separately. As soon as I got the mug, I took off all the wrappings, glanced over the instructions, stuck the tea infuser in, poured in some hot water and began my test. Here are my first impressions:Pros: The mug is definitely great quality. The weight and feel of the mug definitely seems premium. I have two small children in the house, so being able to lock the opening is a great bonus and I'm sure will come in quite handy in the future. I love how it is easy to clean off as well. It's just a all around great travel mug!Cons: Here are a few things for you to consider before buying this to make sure it is not a deal breaker for you! Finger prints... Because it is stainless steal, the mug itself is a fingerprint magnet. I got the black mug, hoping that the fingerprints would be less visible; it's still visible... This is not a deal breaker for me but it could be for you, hense the critic. The bigger critic for me, that almost made me return the mug, is the opening. I love my coffee hot. This mug does an exceptional job keeping it hot for the duration of the day. Unfortunately, the opening on the lid is shallow, which makes it hard for me to control the flow of the liquid. It might just be me, but this causes me to burn my lip and tongue constantly using this mug... I find myself having to open the lid and cool down the coffee/tea before being able to drink from it. Lots of anxiety tilting this thing to drink...Overall, a great mug! If the could deepen the opening a little to give better control, I think this would have been the perfect mug for me.
